About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: El señor Nelson Enrique S. C. es casado tiene 30 años y vive en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, ellos tienen un negocio de venta d e carne de pollo, cerdo y res, ambos trabajan ahi, ellos tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad el cual es la razon  para buscar el sustento diario, es para poder ofrecerle a su hijo un futuro mejor es que solicitan de este prestamo para la compra de mayor inventario de carne, que ayudara a elevar las ventas y a mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique is married, 30 years old and lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla district. They have a business selling chicken, pork and beef. They both (he and his wife) work there. They have a 3 year old son which is the reason they are looking for daily sustenance - to be able to offer their son a better future. This is why they are asking for this loan to buy a greater inventory of meat, which will help increase sales and improve the living conditions of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat for the business

loans.name: His Grace Group

texts.en: His Grace Group is a group of five borrowers led by Aloysius C.. He is 56 years old and is married with six children, 4 to 34 years old, with educational levels of kindergarten through college. Aloysius is an AA college degree holder. In the photo, he is the one holding the sign. Aloysius and his family live in the Snapper Hill Community, Carey Street, in Central Monrovia. Aloysius runs his business in the same community. Aloysius’s business is the sale of charcoal used for cooking. He buys wholesale and sells retail to his customers. He has been running this business for more than ten years and started selling with twenty-five bags of charcoal but now operates with about one hundred bags on hand. Aloysius intends to use the money from his share of this group loan as working capital for his business. Aloysius encourages his customers with a good business relationship. He dreams of giving his family a good life. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sehllin Liseth

texts.es: La señora Sehllin, vive en el barrio Camilo Ortega, casada, con dos hijos una de dos meses de nacido, muy contenta. Su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra,  muy responsable. Su negocio de Sehllin es la venta de ropa y electrodomésticos, y variedades el cual lleva ocho años en las ventas una veces bajas otras semana se mejoran las ventas, gracias a la ayuda de su mama y esposo logro comenzar, su venta luego con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado ha logrado invertir en el inventario de ropa y compra de mas electrodomésticos que ha venido a mejorar sus ingresos para bienestar de su familia. Con este dinero comprara ropa para niños, dama y caballeros, electrodomésticos para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, entre otros encargos que le hacen, da al crédito a clientes que llevan varios años trabajando con ella.  El objetivo con esta inversión es la captación de clientes nuevos, ventas altas, e ir creciendo cada día, ya que la competencia es grande.
texts.en:
Sehllin lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood and is married with two children, one of which is two months old and is very happy. Her husband works as a construction teacher and is very responsible. Sehllin works selling clothing, electrical appliances, and a variety of other items, and has been in the sales business for eight years. Some weeks, sales decrease and they increase in others. Thanks to the help she receives from her mother and husband, she was able to start her business. With the loan from Afodenic, she has been able to invest in clothing inventory and the purchase of more electrical appliances that have come to improve earnings for her family’s well-being. With this loan, she will purchase children’s, women’s, and men’s clothing, and electrical appliances to meet her customer’s demands. Among other assignments that they do for her, she gives credit to her customers with whom she has worked for many years. The goal of this investment is to attract new customers, increase sales, and continue growing each day, since competition is strong.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children, women, and men, as well as electrical appliances to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Josefina Teodosa

texts.en:
Josefina is 54 years old and single. She has no kids and lives in Guayaquil in a cement house with all the basic services.

Josefina was first introduced to the business of selling Avon products through a friend. Using the money she had saved, Josefina bought the merchandise and began selling it herself.

Josefina has fixed clients that she visits during the day to sell the perfumes and lotions she buys from Avon. She is able to buy the Far Away perfume for $26.25 and sell it for $35. Another type of perfume she buys for $28.50 and sells for $38. The lotion she buys for $4.50 and sells for $6.

One difficulty with her work is that Josefina sells her products on credit and sometimes her customers do not pay.

With the loan, Josefina will buy more Avon products to expand her inventory. She would like to continue working with the Avon products and also branch out into Nature’s Garden products as well.

Josefina would also like to finish the construction on her house so she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more Avon products to sell

loans.name: Try And See Group

texts.en: Try and See is a group of five borrowers led by Susannah C.. She is 51 years old and married with four children. Her children are aged from 4 to 14 years, with educational levels from 2nd grade to 7th grade. Susannah was not able to go to school due to poverty. For 10 years, Susannah has been selling cement on Johnson Street in central Monrovia. Susannah will use this loan to purchase more cement for her business. She dreams of giving her children a good future by continuing to send them to school and by building them a house as well. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Susannah is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase cement

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Eyeah G. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God’s Blessing. She is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 18-30 years old. Their educational levels are 11th grade to college senior. Eyeah was not able to attend school when she was a youth due to poverty. 

Eyeah's business is sale of food items such as oil, rice, peanuts and beans. She buys her goods wholesale and sells retail on a table to residents of her community in Paynesville. She has been running her business for 20 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.

Eyeah talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Eyeah needs this loan to purchase additional oil, rice, peanuts and beans. Her dream is to continue giving her children an education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Eyeah is the one holding the sign.  Henry T. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil, rice, peanuts and beans.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.fr: D. Nestor est né le 26 Février 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marié et père de cinq enfants, Nestor  vit depuis 21 ans environs au quartier Tokplégbé à Cotonou. Nestor vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Nestor n'a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Depuis près de 27 ans, Nestor fabrique et vend des statuettes au hall des arts à Cotonou. Nestor s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Nestor a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Nestor voudrait renforcer son activité et fabriquer plus de statuettes, en vue de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. C'est ce qui conduit Nestor à solliciter un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nestor D. was born February 26, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married and father of five children, Nestor has been living for the past 25 years in the Tokplégbé neighborhood of Cotonou. He lives there with his children and his wife, with whom he shares responsibility for family expenses. Nestor has only attended primary school. For over 27 years he has been crafting and selling statuettes at the Cotonou Arts and Crafts Hall. He gets his supplies in Cotonou. Nestor has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, and reimbursed it in full. He would like to reinforce his activity and produce more statuettes in response to customer demand. For this reason he is now requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and paint

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta, tiene 73 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que ya son independientes. Fausta forma parte del banco comunal “Sol D. Oro” D. la Asociación Arariwa. Fausta tiene una cabina D. Internet, ella contrato un joven para la atención D. la cabina. Ya son 3 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fausta es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora requiere el crédito para comprar  3 computadoras. Fausta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fausta is 73 years old, married with five adult children. Fausta is a member of the “Sol D. Oro” (Golden Sun) communal bank, of the Arariwa Association. She has a cyber café and hired a young man to run it for her. She has been doing this for three years and she has been doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Fausta is a hard working and enterprising woman who needs a loan to buy three computers. She is thankful for the opportunity provided by this medium and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computers

loans.name: Pedro Norbel

texts.es:
Pedro es soltero, tiene 19 años y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a transportar carga y pasajeros desde hace cuatro años manejando mototaxi. Empezó desde muy joven alquilando motos y manejándolas en sus tiempos libres, y poco a poco fue ahorrando dinero hasta que pudo adquirir su propio vehículo. Actualmente el se gana la vida trabajando en su unidad móvil, cubriendo rutas que unen a la ciudad de Olmos con sus caseríos y anexos.

Debido al continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi y a que los caminos de la zona son muy agrestes, esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que perjudican su correcto funcionamiento. Pedro desea repararlas pero no cuenta con el suficiente capital para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Pedro desea seguir trabajando para hacerce más conocido y apoyar a su padres. El es un joven honrado y trabajador. Ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de aumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Pedro is single and 19-years old. He lives with his parents and his brothers in the Olmos district, which is located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked for four years transporting cargo and passengers as a taxi driver. He started at a young age renting motorcycles and driving them in his free time. He saved his money bit by bit until he could buy his own vehicle. Currently, he makes his living using his vehicle to cover routes in the city of Olmos and in the nearby villages. Due to continual use of his taxi and the fact that the roads in the area are rough, his vehicle has started to have some problems that are affecting how it runs. Pedro wants to make the repairs but he does not have enough capital to do so. This is why he is applying for a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for a credit of 1000 new soles. Pedro wants to continue working and growing his reputation and support his parents. He is an honorable and hard-working young man. He has worked with our institution before and he has proven to be a responsible client and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance on taxi

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Martha E. is the leader of group 5 borrowers called United. She is 52 years old and married with 5 children, aged 20-33 years old. She also cares for one of her grandchildren. Martha was unable to attend school as a youth due to poverty. 

Martha's business is the sale of food items such as plantains, oil and meat. She buys her products from rural Liberia wholesale and sells retail on a table in the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia.  She has been running her business for 12 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.

Martha talks to her customers in a nice manner and sells high quality goods in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. She will use this loan to purchase additional plantains, oil and meat for resale. Her dream is to give her children a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martha is the one holding the sign.  Lawou F. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional plantains, oil and meat.

loans.name: Emilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Emilia del Rosario E. P., de 48 años de edad vive en el barrio de Guadalupe, ella es madre soltera de 3 hijos, el mayor de 26 años, el intermedio de 15 y el pequeño que vive bajo sus dominios.

Ella trabaja ofertando productos y realizabdo encuesta para El Banco Central de Nicaragua, ella solicita un prestamo para la compra de mayor producto de omnilife y de esta manera ir a ofertarlo a nuevos mercados a nivel ancional, esto le traería mejores condiciones económicas, con las que podra oprtar del capital necesario para futuros proyectos, o bien para la mejoría de las condicones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilia del Rosario E. P., 48 years old, lives in the Guadalupe neighborhood. She is a single mother mother of three children, the eldest is 26, the middle child is 15, and the youngest still lives her her. She works selling products and administering surveys for the Central Bank of Nicaragua. She is applying for the loan to purchase more Omnilife products. Omnilife is a producer of health/nutrition products. She hopes that she will be able to offer her products to new markets and thus improve her finances. This would allow her to invest in future products or improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (health/nutrition)

loans.name: Sulemani

texts.en:
Sulemani F. Y. is married and has three children. She has received junior high education.  Sulemani F. sells cosmetics and provisions at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a nurse.  

Sulemani F. uses her income to help her husband in the payment of utility bills and school fees. Sulemani F. will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics and provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sulemani F. plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more cosmetics and provisions for sale

loans.name: Jezed Group

texts.es:
El grupo  JEZED que tiene por significado, Misericordia, esta conformado por  dos mujeres y un varón, los tres son  casados y con hijos. Los negocios son comunes dentro de la comunidad como venta de consumo diario, venta de flores, y animales. El grupo es representados por el señor Luís Antonio T. de 30 años, los integrantes se han dedicado a su negocio hace muchos años con esto ellos han ganado experiencia y el buen servicio les ha dado  preferencia entre sus clientes así mismo  los ha mantenido en el mercado.
Necesitan de más capital para seguir invirtiendo ya que la demanda crece debido a la competencia y ven la necesidad de comprar mas producto para su negocio, que satisfaga la necesidad de las personas que acuden diario hacia sus negocios, de esta manera brindar un buen servicio,   y a la vez ser beneficiados económicamente para el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The JEZED group, which means mercy, is made up of two women and one man. All three are married with children. Their businesses are common in their community such as the sale of daily products, flower selling, and livestock. The group is represented by Mr. Luis Antonio T., who is 30 years old. The members have worked in their businesses for many years, and they have a lot of experience and a strong clientele they have earned with good service. They need more capital to invest in their businesses because demand has grown for their products. It is necessary to buy more supplies for their businesses, so that they can satisfy customer demand. This will benefit them economically, so that they can provide for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for a variety of businesses

loans.name: Maria Edi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes.
Maria es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y brinda servicio de atención de una persona mayor de 89 años de edad y también se dedica una su pequeño taller de confección de buzos. Ya son nueve años que participa de los bancos comunales de la Asociación de Arariwa. La socia Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar tela para confeccionar más buzos.
 
La socia Maria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Maria belongs to the Golden Sun Community Bank of the Arariwa Association and is 53 years old. She is married and has three grown children. Maria is a hard-working mother and a self-starter who works to support her family. She cares for a 89-year old person and also has a little shop where she sews sweatsuits. She has worked with the community bank of the Association of Arariwa for nine years. Maria wants a loan to purchase fabric to sew more sweatsuits. Maria is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Charlotte vit depuis 17 ans à PK10 Vivoten, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à HODEOU Dénis, un transitaire, Charlotte est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Charlotte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis une dizaine d'année, en vue de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Charlotte mène comme activité la vente de fruits et légumes (avocat, papaye, ananas, coco, pommes de terre, carottes, etc.) et aussi de l'igname à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Charlotte fait ses provisions. Charlotte est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution. Charlotte a bien remboursé tous les trois crédits. Charlotte sollicite un quatrième prêt en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Charlotte H. has been living for the past 17 years in PK10 Vivoten, in the Sèmè-Pidji area. Married to Dénis HODEOU, a forwarding agent, Charlotte is mother of three children, all attending school. She lives with her children and her husband, with whom she shares responsibility for household expenses. To handle her share over the past ten years, Charlotte has been selling fruit and vegetables (avocados, papayas, pineapples, coconuts, potatoes, carrots, etc.) from her home. She does her shopping for supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Charlotte is a regular client of ALIDé, having benefited from three previous loans, all repaid in full. She is now requesting a fourth loan, to increase her stock supply in response to customer demands.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, de 65 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos. Actualmente vive con 2 de ellos y su esposo, su casa es de material noble y de dos pisos.

Hace dos años su hija instaló una farmacia en el primer piso de su vivienda, entonces Florinda optó por comprar una  vitrina donde exhibe su stock de productos de belleza. A su vez, diariamente camina en busca de clientes y visita a sus amistades para ofrecer sus productos y recolectar los pedidos mensuales, mientras que su hija la ayuda vendiendo sus productos en la farmacia. Es por ello que se siente muy satisfecha, pues le gusta su negocio, ya que desde su infancia se dedicó al comercio. Ahora con estas ganancias ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar y las necesidades de sus hijos. Por otro lado, la venta de cosméticos le parece muy rentable, además está pensado en vender adornos de cerámica, los cuales son muy demandados por sus bonitos diseños, con los que captará mayores ganancias.

Es por ello que solicita un segundo crédito con MFP, para el crecimiento de su negocio. En tanto, hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que le gustaría seguir trabajando con posteriores créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de sus productos de belleza y la compra de adornos de cerámica.
texts.en:
Florinda is 65 years old and married. She is a hard-working mother of four. Currently she lives with two of her children and her husband. She has a well-built two-story house. Two years ago her daughter started a pharmacy in the first floor of the house. So Florinda decided to buy a display case where she could sell her beauty products. She also sells her products door-to-door and visiting her friends to sell her products and collect monthly orders. Her daughter also helps her buy selling products out of the pharmacy. She feels very satisfied and likes her business, since she has worked in commerce since she was a child. With her profits she helps her husband pay the household costs and fulfill the needs of her children. Cosmetic sales is a profitable business. She is also thinking of selling ceramic ornaments, which are in demand because of their beautiful designs, because this products would bring her even higher profits. She is applying for a loan with MFP to grow her business. She is dedicating to making her payments on time just like she has with previous loans. She will use this loan money to buy more beauty products and ceramic ornaments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Janny Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Janny Maribel A. G., tiene 23 años de edad vive en el Barrio de la Francia, es casada y sus esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad aportando a los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene 3 hijos pequeños el cual el mayor comienza a asistir a la escuela primaria.


Ellos se dedican desde hace 10 años a la agricultura y dentro de los principales problemas que han enfrentado han sido la falta de agua potable que afecta a gran medida a la zona, dentro de los planes del futuro esta la ampliación de la finca para la obtención de mayores ingresos, asi como la compra de un tanque de almacen de agua que aporte el vital liquido a los miembros de la familia, para esto si primero desea realizar una inversión de capital en la  compra de materiales fertilizantes que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a las tierras y ayuden a la produccion y que favorezca a futuro planes que se tienen para la familia.
texts.en:
Janny Maribel A. G. is 23 years old. She lives in a neighborhood called De la Francia. She is married, and her husband works as a security guard, contributing to the household expenses. The couple has 3 small children, with the oldest starting primary school. For the past 10 years, they have worked in agriculture. Among the main problems they have faced has been the lack of potable water, which affects a large portion of their area. Among their plans for the future are expanding their farm in order to obtain a better income, as well as purchasing a water storage tank to provide this vital liquid to the members of their family. Toward this aim, Janny first wants to make a capital investment in fertilizers, which will allow her to maintain her fields more effectively, improve production, and support her plans for the family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers to maintain her fields

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: P. Clotilde est née le 20 Février 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AGBOTON Alain un soudeur, Clotilde est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis une dizaine d'année à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Clotilde n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a près de 7 ans que Clotilde vend du charbon de bois, et aussi des vivres à son domicile. Clotilde s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et au marché de Pahou au Bénin. C'est la première fois que Clotilde sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à renforcer son activité et à mieux répondre à la demande croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Clotilde P. was born February 20, 1975 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Married to Alain AGBOTON, a welder, she is mother of four children, all in school. She herself has only attended primary school. The family has been living for the past ten years at PK10, in the Sèmè-Podji area. The couple shares family expenses. Clotilde started selling charcoal from her home seven years ago, as well as food products. She get her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and also from the Pahou market in Benin. Clotilde is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, which will help her strengthen her activity in response to rising customer demands.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sowing tubers

loans.name: Luisa Argentina

texts.es: Luisa Argentina tiene 36 años, por lo que su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años, por lo que no tenía trabajo estable y al tener que hacerse cargo de sus 2 hijos, que todavía necesitan del cuido y amor de su familia ha superado sus dificultades, es por eso que decide realizar este negocio como un medio de vida para su familia. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con los financiamientos pues siempre se mantiene su negocio, por lo que ha sabido administrar muy bien su dinero. Luisa necesita este financiamiento pues con el comprara productos como camiseras, pantalones, shorts, faldas entre otros ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y es lo que más le solicitan. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda para no recorrer muchos lugares.
texts.en:
Luisa Argentina is 36 years old. Her work is the purchase and sale of clothes. More than 5 years ago she decided to start this business as a way of life as she didn't have a stable job and was in charge of her 2 children, who still need the care and love of their family. For a long time Luisa has worked with finances as she always maintains her business, for which reason she has learnt to administer money very well. Luisa needs this loan to buy products such as shirts, pants, shorts, and skirts, among others, as summer is coming and these products are the most sought after. Her dream is to establish a shop to she doesn't have to travel around lots of places.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase clothes

loans.name: Fernan

texts.es:
Fernan C. A., tiene la edad de 27 años, está soltero, y vive con su madre.El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono, fertilizante y hervicidas, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Fernan tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Fernan C. A. is 27 years old and lives with his mother. He wants the loan to help his farm, specifically to cultivate cafe. He wants to buy fertilisers and herbicides to adequately maintain his coffee cultivation, to achieve better quality and obtain better earninigs when harvest time comes. This isn't the first time he has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities that they provide him. Don Fernan has been working in agriculture for several years. His hope for the future is to give his family a better quality of life and improved economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers and herbicides

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, O. Célestine est mariée à KOUNAHONDE Félicien, un tailleur. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis sept ans à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Célestine a commencé il y a environs sept ans,la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients ; ce qui lui permettra de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Célestine O. is married to Félicien Kounahonde, a tailor. The couple have two children, both of whom attend school. For the past seven years, the family has lived in Djeffa, in the Sèmè-Podji borough of Benin. The couple work together to see to their family's needs; in order to help with this, Célestine began to sell staple foods (corn, beans, etc) from home seven years ago. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Célestine is seeking her first loan from ALIDé, which she will use to bolster her business so that she may better meet her clients' demands, enabling her to increase her profits.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and beans

loans.name: Katia Deyanina

texts.es: Katia es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre soltera, vive en el barrio Loma Linda, su hijo tiene siete meses de nacido, para ella ha sido difícil la situación pero no  imposible continuar adelante que gracias a su mama administra una pulpería que le heredo para que ella pueda administrar y poder sastifacer sus necesidades personales como la de su nieto. Pues desde más antes ella ayudaba  a su mama con la venta. Lo que desea hacer es invertir mas en productos para aumentar el inventario, las ventas, y la captación clientes nuevo lo cual comprara granos básicos; arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite, productos enlatados, cereales, productos lácteos, carne, pollo, y otros que pueda vender. Contenta por este financiamiento ya que mejorara sus utilidades y podrá ayudar a sus padres también.
texts.en:
Katia is a young women of 23 and lives in the suburb of Loma Linda. She is a single mother and her son is 7 months old. For Katie it has been a difficult situation but not impossible to move forward. Thanks to her mother she administers a grocery store that she has inherited from her mother so that she can administer and be able to satisfy her personal necessities and those of her grandson. Katia used to help her mother with the sales. What she wants to do is invest more in products to expand her inventory, the sales, and capture new customers who will buy basic products such as rice, beans, sugar, maize, oil, tinner products, cereals, milk products, meat, chicken and others that she can sell. She is happy about this loan as she will improve her utilities and be able to help her parents as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, maize, canner products, milk

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana runs a toy selling business in her home town of Korolyovo. She sells various kinds of games, stuffed toys, dolls and construction kits for children of different age groups. Her vending kiosk is located right in the center of the marketplace. Oksana launched this enterprise three years ago. Presently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 8,500 Grivnyas and her net profit is about 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Oksana is very sociable. Her friendliness and respectful attitude have given her a good reputation at the market. She has also proven to be a good manager of her finances. She has received and promptly repaid all previous loans. Loans have enabled a gradual expansion of her business. Oksana is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to increase her working capital and re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to open one more vending location in the nearest future.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and re-stock her inventory of toys for sale

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has two children. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo, where she sells pastries and candies in the central marketplace. Her vending kiosk is located right at the entrance to the market, which benefits her trade. Nataliya has been running this business for 15 years. Currently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas a month and her net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas a month.   

Nataliya is requesting an 11,000 Grivnya loan to increase the variety of merchandise she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. Nataliya is very customer friendly. She is very prompt with payments. We are hoping she will get this timely financial support, which is so crucial for her as her venture is a main source of income for her family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise she sells

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a private entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She owns a women’s footwear sales business in one of the local marketplaces called “Yubileinyi”. Zhanna has her own loyal clientele. She has been in this trade for seven years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Zhanna is requesting a 6,000 Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase additional merchandise. She is hoping to open new vending locations and expand her trade as a result. Zhanna has had a perfect credit history. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital and purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Calle 20 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Estas cinco personas integrantes de este grupo son personas que tienen mucho 
honorabilidad en la comunidad en donde viven, debido a que cada dia 
se esfuerzan en sus pequeños negocios para lograr el desarrollo de sus hijos,
como en la educación, salud y vestuario que sol las necesidades básicas de la
familia, y sobre todo son personas responsables y colaboradoras en la comunidad
y como también se les conoce básicamente atreves de sus negocios como 
por ejemplo: venta de comidas, pollos, ropa y tortillas la cual desde hace 
cinco año vienen desarrollando estas actividades. Atreves de estos pequeños 
negocios han venido superándose ya que anteriormente no cuentan para 
poder pagar los estudios y las necesidades de la familia, por lo tanto para  
que sus negocios tengan estabilidad se vieron en la necesidad de acudir a la
Asociación Asdir para solicitar un préstamo para la continua satisfacción de sus 
necesidades.
texts.en:
These 5 members of the group are very honourable peope in the community where they live. This is owing to the fact that every day in their small businesses they work very hard to allow the development of their children and family, and above all they are all responsible people and collaborators in the community. They are known for their work such as : food sales, chicken, clothes, tortillas, and they have been developing these activities for over 5 years. Because of these businesses they have been able to improve their lives, as previously they couldn't pay for their families' studies and necessities. For this reason to ensure that their businesses remain stable they need to approach Asociación Asdir to seek a loan to continue satisfying their necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has three children. She has received a junior high education. Mary moves from place to place, selling pastries around Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a commercial driver. Mary uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Mary will use this loan to purchase more margarine, flour, sugar and other ingredients to use for the making of the pastries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more margarine, flour, sugar and other ingredients to use for the making of the pastries for sale

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan is married and has two daughters. He is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. He owns a transportation business and offers taxi services in the territory of Ukraine. Bogdan launched this business about nine years ago. Currently, he gets 7,000 Grivnyas of income each month.  

Bogdan is seeking a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to repair the running gear of his car. He has much experience working in the field of transportation. He used to be a public van driver, but then he decided to quit and start his own venture. Bogdan’s transportation business is the only source of income for his family of four. He is hoping to continue with this business and make some savings for his children’s college.

loans.use: To repair the car used in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Mariamah

texts.en:
Mariamah A. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. Mariamah sells peppers, tomatoes and other food items at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a teacher. Mariamah uses her income to support the husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Mariamah will use this loan to purchase more food items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mariamah plans to save to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for resale

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and has a five-year-old son. His wife has a disability status. He is a private businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk. He runs a transportation service business. Volodimir offers taxi and delivery services all over the territory of Ukraine. He has been working in this industry for five years. Presently, he has about 5,000 Grivnyas of monthly income.  

Volodimir is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnya loan to do major repairs on his car engine. His car runs on methane-rich gas. These repairs will improve the efficiency of his vehicle and facilitate his work as a result. Moreover, generated income will help him finish construction of his private house. This business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: To do major engine repairs

loans.name: Oswalda

texts.es:
Oswalda tiene 50 años, es una mujer entregada al trabajo, pues desde que se separó de su pareja tuvo que afrontar sola la alimentación y educación de sus 3 hijos, ahora dos de ellos ya son mayores e independientes, por aun cuida del menor. 

Desde su infancia ha trabajado arduamente, por lo que quedarse sola a cargo de sus hijos no le fue muy difícil. Anteriormente se era vendedora ambulante y con las ganancias que captó logró construir su casa propia, donde instaló una tienda de comestibles. Es así que desde hace 8 años se dedica a la atención de su tienda donde también vende verduras y frutas, pues con éstas gana más que con los abarrotes. Por ello, tres veces a la semana, se levanta a las 3 de la madruga para ir de compras al mercado mayorista y adquirir las frutas y demás productos. A Oswalda le gusta vender, esta actividad la mantiene muy entretenida y conversa con sus clientes, además en algunas oportunidades sus hijos la apoyan y eso la reconforta mucho. 

Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que ratifica su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Asimismo, señala que trabaja en armonía con sus compañeras grupo. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita piensa comprar útiles escolares y venderlos en su bodega para aprovechar la campaña escolar y captar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Oswalda is 50 years old and is a woman who is devoted to her work. Since separating from her partner, she was faced with providing food and education to her 3 children. Now two of them are older and independent, but she still cares for the younger one.

She has worked arduously since she was young, so having to care for her children on her own was not very difficult for her. She was previously a door-to-door saleswoman and with her earnings, she was able to build her own house where she set up a grocery store. This is how, for the past 8 years, she has been working in her store where she also sells fruits and vegetables, since she earns more with these than with the groceries. She wakes up at 3am three times per week to go shopping at the wholesale market and purchase fruits and other products. Oswalda likes selling because it keeps her entertained and she talks with her customers. Her children also help her sometimes and that comforts her a lot.

This is her eighth loan with MFP, which confirms her commitment to making her loan repayments on the assigned dates. It also shows that she works in harmony with her fellow group members. With this loan that she is requesting, she plans to purchase school supplies and sell them in her store to take advantage of the beginning of school and attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase desk supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, pues además tiene que brindarle la atención necesaria a sus hijos. Por lo que además labora como docente y este salario no le es suficiente para mantener a su familia. A pesar de ser una actividad muy minoritaria trata de mejorar los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de uniformes escolares ya que tiene ciertos encargos, ropa interior y ropa en general. Ella sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 42 years old and she sells clothing. She has been in this humble business for more than 8 years. She has to get up very early to complete the household chores, in addition to having to provide her children with the necessary attention. She also works in teaching, but this salary is not sufficient for her to support her family. Despite being a minority business, she tries to improve her income to improve her quality of life. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of school uniforms, as she already has a few orders for underwear and clothing in general. María Mercedes dreams of her children finishing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia V. C., tiene la edad de 73 años, es viuda, pero actualmente vive con un señor de 77 años y con un hijo de 15 años de edad que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña María Eugenia tiene muchos años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
María Eugenia V. C. is a 73-year-old widow, but she currently lives with a 77-year-old man and a 15-year-old son, who is her biggest priority. The loan that she is requesting is to purchase materials and remodel the pigsty, in addition to purchasing some pigs to raise. The idea is to raise the pigs properly in order to obtain the best income possible when they are sold. This is María Eugenia’s first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very pleased with the credit facilities that they provide to her. María Eugenia has been in the business of raising pigs for many years. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life, more economic stability, and be able to continue growing as a person and a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Shalom, esta conformado por 5 miembros, las cuales al mismo tiempo son vecinas, y residentes en San Juan Sacatepequez,  cada miembro tiene  diferente actividad tales como, venta de pasteles,  venta de regalos, venta de granizadas, venta de ropa, y venta de  consumo diario. 
Es representada por la señora Ilci G., de 25 años quien con la iniciativa de prosperar y al ver la necesidad, compartió la idea a  sus compañeras, en solicitar un crédito, ya que en años pasados ella trabajo en un Banco de confianza con FAPE, por lo que ella dice que este tipo de crèditos le han ayudado a mantener su negocio y  tambièn le permite  mantener a sus de sus 2 hijos. Todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras  y cada una de ella cuenta que su sueño es ver prosperar sus negocios  y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Shalom group is comprised of five members who are neighbors and residents of San Juan Sacatepequez. Each member has a different activity like selling pastries, selling gifts, selling shaved ice, selling clothes, and selling daily consumer products. Ilci G., age 25, represents the group. Motivated by the desire to prosper, and seeing the necessity, she shared the idea of asking for a loan with her colleagues. Years ago she worked in a communal bank with FAPE. She says that these types of loans have helped maintain her business, and they also allow her to support her two children. All of the women are very hard-workers. Each one of them has a dream to see their businesses prosper and help their children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Rigoberto

texts.en:
Carlos lives in a cement house, in Guayaquil, with water and electricity. He is 46 and married, but his wife lives in Spain. Together they have three children: 24, 22, and 14 years old, the youngest of whom attends high school. Carlos used to work as a collector for a department store, but decided to start his own business running a small store, where he sells products on credit.

Carlos´ son helps him in the store and also goes around town collecting payments from customers from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. One difficulty that Carlos has is that the area is not safe, and there are many thieves he has to protect his business from.

With the loan, Carlos is planning to buy sheets, clothes, and food to sell in his store. In the future he would like to have more products in the store and to be able to expand the customer base of those paying with credit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his store (clothes, sheets, and food)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken for her business and a canoe motor for her husband's crab fishing business

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan José vive en el Memorial Sandino, tiene 43 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos los cuales estudian, desde hace cuatro años administra una pulpería que inicio con capital de una vacas que vendió el cual invirtió en esta pequeña pulpería para poder dar a su familia el sustento de cada día. Su objetivo con este préstamo es poder invertir en productos  de consumo diario como granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, ase, cereales, carnes y lácteos para incrementar las ventas. Las dificultades que ha tenido es que no tiene el suficiente capital para surtirla en variedad de productos, pero gracias al financiamiento ha logrado hacer el aumento a su inversión. Que espera mejorar a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Juan José lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is 43 years old and married, with three children who are in school. For the past four years, he has operated a general store, which he began with capital from some cows he sold. He invested the money in this little store in order to provide for his family's daily needs. His aim with the current loan is to invest in staple foods and basic items such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, cleaning supplies, cereals, meats and dairy products in order to increase his sales. One of the difficulties he has faced has been the lack of sufficient capital to stock his store with a variety of products, but thanks to the financing, he has been able to increase his investment. He hopes to improve this situation even further over the long term.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying staple foods to increase his inventory and improve sales

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre los financiamientos han sido de gran apoyo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, hielo y gaseosa. Por lo que desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar, pues ha tenido más de 31 años este negocio, sus experiencias han sido las mejores pues le ha ido muy bien con este negocio, por lo que ella pone mucho empeño y esfuerzo. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para su negocio, por lo que se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada. En un futuro le gustaría aumentar su negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria has collaborated with Fundación León 2000 for a long time; the loans have always been a big help. She sells clothing, ice and soft-drinks. She has enjoyed working since she was very young; she has been in this line of work for over 31 years. Her experiences have been the best because she has done well with the business because she puts a lot of effort and determination into it. She is asking for financing to buy stock items for her business and she is very grateful for the opportunity offered her. In the future, she would like to increase her business and sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Remove

texts.es: REMOVE L.
texts.en:
These people that currently live in the Candelaria sector of the village Nahualata, San Antonio Suchitepéquez, are very responsible, since in the community where they live, they collaborate for each activity done. They also have their small businesses in the community, which are to benefit and meet the needs of the community residents. They have the support of their husbands that work on different cane cutting farms, but their earnings are not sufficient for basic needs such as the education of their children. As a result, they work very hard with their businesses to be able to obtain an acceptable education. This is why they thought it necessary to go to the association’s office to apply for a L. to meet their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: REMOVE

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus is 44 years old and married with 13 children, ranging in age from 9 months to 25 years old. Nine of his children are currently attending school. He has run a mixed farm in the western region of Kenya, just outside the town of Kitale, for the past 10 years. His primary source of income comes from milk production, which he sells to the local retailers.

He says that there are a number of everday challenges to face with farming in this region, with the main issue being that the milk market can at times become quite saturated. Unpredictable weather patterns can often be difficult, as well as problems with spreading disease among livestock. Even when faced with these problems, Chrispinus has successfully completed a previous loan with Juhudi Kilimo and has maintained profitable business operations.

Chrispinus requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 25,000 to expand his stock of poultry in an effort to further diversify his farm production. He says that the extra income from this project will go towards providing for his family's well being. Looking forward, he hopes to build up his credit over time in order to take out a larger loan in the future to start a new, bigger project.

loans.use: To expand his stock of poultry in an effort to further diversify his farm production

loans.name: Angelita De Lourdes

texts.es:
Angelita C. de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos uno de 15 y otro de 23 años.

Inicio el negocio de ventas de cosméticos hace ya mucho tiempo. Una de sus amigas le hablo sobre Yanbal y empezó como vendedora ambulante. 

Ahora Angelita tiene en su casa una pequeña vitrina con productos como cremas, perfumes, shampoo, etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días. Dos de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia y las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes y cremas para tener más variedad en su negocio. En el futuro quiere ser Directora de Ventas.
texts.en:
Angelita C. is 46 years old and lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil, in a zone in the urban outskirts. Her house is made of cement and has all of the basic services. She is single, but has 2 children – one is 15 and the other is 23.

She began her fruit and cosmetic business a long time ago. One of her friends told her about Yanbal, and she began as a door-to-door saleswoman.

Now Angelita has a small display case in her house with products such as cream, perfume, shampoo, etc. She works from 8:00am to 9:00pm every day. Two of the complications that she has are delinquency and the rains.

With this loan, she wants to purchase perfume and cream to have more variety in her business. In the future, she wants to be a sales manager.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and creams

loans.name: Duban Enrique

texts.es:
Duban M. P., tiene 45 años está casado y tiene 3 hijos en edades de 8 meses, 11 y 15 años. Él es un mecánico industrial que trabajó en una empresa declarada en concordato, razón por la cual  se vio obligado a renunciar  e ingresó en una distribuidora de productos populares de consumo; allì se le ocurrió la idea de solicitarle a esta empresa crédito en sus productos,  para venderlos por encargo desde su casa a sus amistades mas cercanas; así empezó la venta de ranchos, víveres y bebidas por encargo. Muy prontamente, realizando las dos actividades, apoyado por su esposa y su padre, ascendió en su cargo,  pero debía  viajar constantemente y ausentarse semanalmente de su familia, que cada día  necesitaba al padre y al esposo mas cerca, “y no de visita como decía su esposa”; simultáneamente su negocio crecía y ganaba mas en él, que como empleado. Así fue como decidió retirarse y dedicarse tiempo completo a su familia y a su negocio;  Duban, tiene en la sala de su apartamento una estantería llena de productos de consumo familiar que le solicitan telefónicamente o por vía Internet, es así como el concepto que él maneja  no es una tienda de exhibición al público, sino una especie de bodega instalada donde recibe pedidos y los envía a domicilio.

 El está muy orgulloso de disfrutar a su bebe, a sus dos hijos menores de edad y a su esposa y de apoyarlos mas en su día a día;  el negocio en su casa y en su dirección, ha mejorado el entorno familiar y controla mejor sus ingresos, lo que representa mayor bienestar en su hogar. Su sueño es montar su auto servicio y esta buscando un local,  ha comprado nueva estantería y se prepara para aumentar su clientela, porque quiere ser más competitivo, generar mayores ingresos y mas empleo en especial en su familia. Para iniciar su camino de cumplir su sueño solicita un crédito  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancias para llenar sus nuevos estantes, intenta que allí lo conozcan comercialmente,  pues este es la primera solicitud que hace a esta organización.  Sus mayores desafíos son su crecimiento como persona y como empresario, trabajar persistentemente para educar a sus hijos y tener una casa propia. Duban vive en un barrio de tradiciones culturales de origen muy caribe , cercano a la casa del Carnaval, el Barrio Abajo compuesto de gente entusiasta, con un potencial beisbolero pues tiene el estadio mas reconocido que ha formado integralmente  a  beisbolistas internacionales como  Edgar Rentaría, hoy en las grandes Ligas el béisbol de EEUU.
texts.en:
Duban M. P., 45, is married and has three children, who are an 8-month-old baby and an 11-year-old and 15 years old. He is a mechanical engineer who worked for a company that declared bankruptcy. Because of this, he had to resign his position there and he began to work for a company that distributes popular consumer products. Once there, he came up with the idea to ask this company to give him merchandise on credit so that he could sell them from home to his close friends; these sales would be based on prior orders. Thus began his business filling orders for snacks, food items and beverages. Soon, doing both jobs and with help from his wife and father, he was promoted in his job. However, this required frequent travel and weekly separations from his family, who increasingly needed the presence of both husband and father and “not just passing through” as his wife said. At the same time, his home-based business kept growing and he earned more from it than as a salaried employee. He decided to retire therefore and dedicate himself full-time to his family and his own business. Duban has shelving in his living room that is filled with household items that are ordered from him via telephone and Internet. This is his work modus operandi; it isn’t a store that is open to the public but, rather, a type of warehouse that is set up to fill orders that are then sent out for home delivery. He is very proud to be able to enjoy the company of his baby, his two children and his wife and to be able to be there for them in their day-to-day lives. Having his business at home has improved his family structure and he is able to control his income better which is of great benefit for his household. His dream is to set up a self-service store and is looking for an appropriate locale for it. He has purchased new shelving and is preparing for an influx of customers because he wants to be more competitive, generate higher earnings and employment, especially in his family. To start his journey toward meeting this goal he needs funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy merchandise to fill his new shelves. His aim is to become known commercially there for this is his first loan request from the organization. His greatest challenges are his growth as a person and as an entrepreneur, to work persistently to educate his children, and to have his own home. Duban lives in a neighborhood, Barrio Abajo, which is rich in Caribbean cultural traditions, near the site of Barranquilla’s Carnival; a neighborhood made up of enthusiastic people with a marked potential for baseball since it has the most well-known stadium from which have risen internationally famous baseball players, like Edgar Rentaría, who is now part of the US Major Leagues.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité LAS TRINFADORAS, están en el 5° ciclo del programa bancomunal la linea de crédito que manejan es de 100.000 Gs. Hasta 1000.000 ellas comentan en cada seguimiento que luchan cada día para seguir adelante y la rutina de muchas de ellas consiste en  levantarse a las 05:20 am todos los días, van a la ciudad de Clorinda (Argentina.), como es el caso específico de la señora Nancy quien se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de uso domestico al menudeo y esto lo reparte entra las integrantes del comité y otras vecinas quienes son sus clientas y le pagan cada semana por las mercaderías que ella les provee.
Quienes en este ciclo se integran al comité, comenta que se siente muy feliz ya que es una oportunidad para volver a emprender sus actividades. 
Ellas agradecen infinitamente a KIVA Y la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brinda.
texts.en:
The LAS TRIUNFADORAS committe are in their fifth communal bank loan cycle; they manage a line of credit that ranges from 100,000 to 1.000.000 guaranís. They comment at each follow-up that they struggle daily to continue forward. The daily routine of many of them consists of rising at 5:20am every day, they go to the city of Clorinda (Argentina). This is the case of Nancy, who sells articles for the home. She distributes these among her fellow committee members and among other neighbors, who are her customers; they pay weekly for the merchandise she provides. Those who are members of the committee this cycle comment that they are happy to have the opportunity to undertake their activities again. They are infinitely grateful to KIVA and to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have been given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies like:  flour, cooking oil, sugar, baked goods, dairy goods.

loans.name: Ana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ana del Socorro began selling fruits and vegetables at 8 years old with her mother in the local Masaya market.  When Ana was 23 years old she started her own fruit and vegetable business independent of her mother as she had begun a family of her own.

Ana is an excellent client of ADIM, she originally began borrowing through group loans and later graduated to the level where she could borrow with individual credit.  She will use this loan to buy products where the prices have increased; for example the cost has risen for  a bag of sweet peppers, tomatoes, pipián amongst many others.
texts.en:
Ana del Socorro began selling fruits and vegetables at 8 years old with her mother in the local Masaya market. When Ana was 23 years old she started her own fruit and vegetable business independent of her mother as she had begun a family of her own. Ana is an excellent client of ADIM, she originally began borrowing through group loans and later graduated to the level where she could borrow with individual credit. She will use this loan to buy products where the prices have increased; for example the cost has risen for a bag of sweet peppers, tomatoes, pipián amongst many others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables like peppers, tomtoes, pumpkin.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Gregorio (36), quien es obrero de una mina, y de sus 4 hijas: Rosario (16), Yazmín (14), Xiomara (8) y Rubí (5).

Desde muy joven aprendió las técnicas del tejido, porque su madre le inculcó este arte, y desde entonces no ha parado de tejer. En la actualidad elabora todo tipo de prendas y tapetes y se ha dado cuenta que es un negocio muy rentable; además es un oficio que le gusta mucho porque la relaja y es tranquilo, pues lo desarrolla en la tranquilidad de su casa. 
Paralelamente a esta actividad, desde hace un año, se dedica a la preparación y venta de desayunos y almuerzos, los que reparte a sus habituales comensales, trabajadores de la zona por donde vive, quienes le pagan mensualmente. Siendo una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño restaurante donde pueda ofrecer sus comidas con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible la obtención de su crédito para su progreso. Con el dinero que solicita comprará lana e hilo para continuar tejiendo, ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar y no quiere quedar mal con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen, 36, lives in her own house with her husband, Gregorio, 36, who works in a mine, and their four daughters: Rosario, 16, Yazmín, 14, Xiomara, 8 and Rubí, 5. She learned to weave as a little girl because her mother taught her this art; since then, she hasn't stopped weaving. Currently, she makes all kinds of clothing articles and rugs and she has noted that it is a very profitable business. Besides, it is an occupation that she enjoys very much because it's calm and it relaxes her; she can do it from the comfort of her home. In addition to this activity, for the past year she has sold prepared breakfasts and lunches to her regular diners who are, for the most part, local laborers; they pay her on a monthly basis. Being a very enterprising woman, she is planning to set up a small restaurant in the future where she can offer her meals with more tranquility. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very grateful to all those people who make getting credit possible for her progress. With the requested funds she will buy wool and thread to continue weaving since she has several orders pending and she does not want to disappoint her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and thread.

loans.name: San Patricio Group

texts.es:
The San Patricio Group is made of three woman entrepreneurs.  

Deysis del Carmen C. has been purchasing and selling fruits and vegetables in the market of her home town, Masaya, Nicaragua, since 1998. By the means of this business she has been able to raise 8 children, three of which are 16, 14, and 9 years old and live with her. Deysis said she will use the loan to purchase more godos to sell, and with the income it generates she will be able to repair her cart which is deteriorating.  

The other women in the group are Francisca U. who cultivates fruits and vegetables to sell, and Paulina Bermudez who has been selling fruits and vegetables since she was 12 years old, she has a small store in her home.
texts.en:
The San Patricio Group is made of three woman entrepreneurs. Deysis del Carmen C. has been purchasing and selling fruits and vegetables in the market of her home town, Masaya, Nicaragua, since 1998. By the means of this business she has been able to raise 8 children, three of which are 16, 14, and 9 years old and live with her. Deysis said she will use the loan to purchase more godos to sell, and with the income it generates she will be able to repair her cart which is deteriorating. The other women in the group are Francisca U. who cultivates fruits and vegetables to sell, and Paulina Bermudez who has been selling fruits and vegetables since she was 12 years old, she has a small store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 32 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 3 hijos; Bryan (18), Johan (12) y Maricielo (8). Ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante para dar lo mejor a su familia a pesar de que está separada de su cónyuge.

Desde que era muy joven aprendió lo que era el trabajo duro, es por esta razón que cuando tuvo que afrontar sola la crianza de sus hijos no dudó en emprender un negocio que le fuera rentable y que le permitiera seguir con el cuidado de ellos. Es así que hace 10 años empezó con la venta de ropa a pedido y al crédito, notó las buenas ganancias que obtenía y en la actualidad compra mercadería de acuerdo a la época del año, por ejemplo ahora para la campaña escolar está vendiendo uniformes de colegio. Esta mujer, cada día busca que salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo, a su vez le gusta su trabajo porque es tranquilo y lo realiza desde su casa.
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de ropa en algún centro comercial donde haya gran afluencia de público.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hace posible que pueda acceder al crédito para seguir trabajando. Carmen tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en uniformes y zapatos de colegio, sabiendo que en marzo se inician clases.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32, and she lives in her parents’ house with her three children. Bryan is 18, Johan is 12, and Maricielo is 8. She has a great desire to get ahead in order to give her family the best in spite of the fact that she is separated from her life partner. When she was very young she learned what hard work is. It is for that reason that, when confronted with raising her children alone, she had not doubts about undertaking a business that would be profitable and allow her to keep taking care of her children. That is how she started selling clothes by order and on credit ten years ago. She noted the good earnings she obtained. She currently buys merchandise according to the time of year. For example, it is now the school season, and she is selling school uniforms. This woman puts forth much effort looking to get ahead everyday. She likes her work because it is peaceful, and she does it from her house. In the future she plans to set up a clothing store in a commercial center where there are a lot of people. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very grateful to the people who make it possible for her to access a loan in order to keep working. Knowing that classes start in March, Carmen plans to use the money she is requesting to buy a bigger quantity of uniforms and school shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo Modelo B. tiene 52 años y vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge  y sus cuatro hijos en las edades de 25 y 34 años;  Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de fritos, bebidas aromáticos, café, canela y toronjil entre otras; es muy usual  ver a Guillermo, por la tarde de 2 a 9 p.m., circulando por Metrocentro, un centro comercial muy bien conocido en el sur de Barranquilla; Inició este negocio como vendedor de café en el año 2003, y gradualmente fue agregando  bebidas aromáticas variadas y fritos. Antes de  tener este negocio, vendía mercancías puerta a puerta, este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y desde que lo adquirió el ha sentido que ha  progresado, en términos de sus ingresos que han podido aumentar. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $ 1.300.000 para  mejorar la presentación  de su negocio y cooperar en la conservación ambiental; él va a invertirlo en la compra de equipos de trabajo que están deteriorándose: por ejemplo una cava, unos termos, una licuadora, un exprimidor de naranjas y una vitrina térmica.
Su mayor desafío es progresar en su negocio y ayudar a que su familia salga adelante; sueña con tener ubicado su negocio en un sitio estable donde pueda vender sus productos y con tener una casa propia lo cual generaría mucha estabilidad.
texts.en:
Guillermo Modelo B. is 52 years old and lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, with his spouse and his four children, who are between the ages of 25 and 34. He works preparing and selling fried foods and aromatic beverages, including coffee, cinnamon tea, melissa tea, and others. Between 2 and 9 p.m., it is very common to see Guillermo circulating in Metrocentro, a very well-known shopping center in the south of Barranquilla. He started this business as a coffee vendor in 2003, and he gradually added a variety of beverages and fried foods. Before starting this business, he sold merchandise door to door. This is his second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and since receiving credit, he feels that he has made progress in terms of his income, which he has been able to increase. He is currently applying for a loan in the value of 1,300,000 Colombian pesos (COP) to improve the presentation of his business and to help protect the environment. He will invest the funds in purchasing equipment for his business that is currently in poor condition, such as a cooler, some thermos bottles, a blender, an orange juicer and a thermal display case. His greatest challenge is to make progress with his business and help his family get ahead. He dreams of operating his business on a permanent site where he can sell his products, and having a house of his own, which would give him great stability.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing equipment for his business, such as a cooler, thermos bottles, a blender, an orange juicer and a thermal display case

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith, de 32 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su esposo Rubén (40), que es transportista, y de sus 2 hijos: Fabricio (3) y Viviana (1).

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de calzado para hombre, a ella le gusta vender, sobretodo a sus amigos varones, pues ellos no son muy exigentes al momento de elegir con qué se vestirán y esto facilita sus ventas. Lo que no le gusta es tener que trasladar la mercadería desde la ciudad hasta la zona donde vive, pero las ganancias son buenas por lo que está muy satisfecha, ya que puede contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Como es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, para el futuro se ha proyectado a instalar un puesto de zapatos solo para varones en algún mercado de su localidad, pues tiene varios clientes fijos que siempre acuden a ella en busca de novedades.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para seguir trabajando en busca de progreso. A su vez, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está compuesto de mujeres muy trabajadoras al igual que ella. Edith tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de zapatos, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y le falta sólo el capital.
texts.en:
