Edith, 32, lives in a rented house with her husband Ruben, 40, who works in transportation, and their 2 children: Fabricio, 3 and Viviana, 1. For 10 years she has sold all types of shoes for men. She enjoys selling, most of all to her male friends, because they are not very picky about choosing what to wear and this facilitates her sales. The part of the job she does not enjoy is having to move her merchandise from the city to the neighborhood where she lives, but the earnings are good and for this reason she is quite satisfied as she is able to contribute to the household expenses. As she is a very enterprising mother, for the future she has plans to establish a stand in a local market where she can sell men's shoes, because she has a number of regular customers who always come to her looking for the newest styles. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to access this credit so that she can continue working in search of progress. At the same time, she is content with the work of her communal bank because it is made up of very hardworking women like herself. Edith plans to invest the money that she requests in the purchase of a greater quantity of shoes, since she has a large number of orders and lacks only the capital needed to fill them.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy men's shoes)

loans.name: Yack Oswaldo

texts.es:
Yack A. de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa es empleada domestica con ella tiene 2 hijos.

Inicio el negocio de ventas de cosméticos hace ya mucho tiempo. Una de sus amigas lo incentivo e inscribió a la esposa para que fuera vendedora de cosméticos, pero como necesitaban ingresos, tuvo que trabajar el también en la venta de los cosméticos. 

Ahora el trabaja en conjunto con su esposa desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Se ayudan con los folletos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras y bloques para poder construir mejor su vivienda. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para la venta de los cosméticos.
texts.en:
Yack A. is 45 years old. He lives in an area in the outskirts of town on the Perimetral de Guayaquil. His house is made of cement. It has only electricity and water as basic services. His wife is a domestic worker. He has two children with her. He began the business of selling cosmetics a long time ago. One of his friends gave him the incentive and he signed his wife up so that she could be a cosmetics salesperson. Since they needed income, he had to work in cosmetic sales as well. Now he works with his wife from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 pm every day. They help each other with the pamphlets. With the loan he wants to buy cement, stone and blocks to be able to improve his housing. In the future he plans on having his own locale to sell cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CEMENT, STONE, BLOCKS

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra R. P. has been selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya Market for ten years.  She needs this loan because her business is growing.  Silvestra will use the loan to buy tamarind, avacado, oranges, plums and other fruits in season.

Silvestra has participated in ADIM’s personal and business development program; it teaches women how to recognize and improve self-esteem, manage their small business efficiently, and empower individuals. She said the program has really helped with the performance of her business , her perception of herself, and her personal relationships.

loans.use: To buy fruits in season

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 48-year-old single woman who runs a mixed farm near Kitale, Kenya. She has three children, ages 13, 26, and 28, with her youngest child still in school. She has been farming for more than ten years, and earns most of her income by selling maize and beans in the local markets. She also earns extra income from her part-time involvement in the local timber business. She says that the main challenges she faces in her work are high fluctuation in market prices and increasingly high competition for sales.

Jacinta requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 20,000 to start her own poultry business, in an effort to diversify her production. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her family in many ways, including supporting her youngest child in finishing school. She said that with enough effort on her part, she will be able to successfully expand her business and take care of her family's basic needs, now and in the future.

Jacinta is thus far pleased with her first foray into microfinance, and she hopes that she will continue to be funded so that she can be empowered as a woman in Kenya.

loans.use: To start a poultry business

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline, de 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos, aunque es muy joven busca que trabajar y salir adelante.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, lo hace con la modalidad de catálogos, donde sus clientes ven lo que les agrada y se lo piden. También vende productos que tiene en stock y obtiene muy buenas ganancias. Le gusta mucho este  trabajo porque es tranquilo y confía mucho en su capacidad de persuasión para recomendar a sus compradoras los colores de maquillaje que más les asientan. Paralelamente a esta actividad, desde hace 3 años, se dedica también a preparar pasteles, los que vende una vez por semana (viernes), elabora media docena y los vende por pedido, sus clientes comentan que son muy deliciosos por eso esperan con muchas ansias los fines de semana. Y como ella es una joven muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de gas doméstico en su propia casa, ya que dice: “espacio le sobra”, así como ganas de seguir trabajando.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, que permite a muchas personas, como ella, a salir adelante. Jakeline tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de productos de belleza, ya que le gusta tener una buena cantidad en stock para venderlos a mayor precio ante cualquier necesidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jakeline, 21 years old, lives in her parents home in the company of her parents and siblings. Even though she is very young, she is looking to work and get ahead. She makes her living selling a brand of beauty products known world wide. She makes her sales using catalogs, where her customer see what they like and order through her. She also sells products that she has in stock, which makes her a very good profit. She likes this type a work a lot because it is laid-back, and she is very confident in her persuasive abilities in recommending the make-up colors best suited to her buyers. Along with that work, for the last 3 years she has also made a living preparing pastries, which she sells one day a week (Fridays). She makes a half dozen and sells them as they are ordered. Her customers remark that they are very delicious, and make them look forward to the weekend. And because she is a very enterprising young woman, in the future she plans to install a store in her own home to sell domestic gas since, as she says, "space, she has plenty of," just like her desire to continue working. This is her second loan and she is very grateful to all those who have made the loans possible; they allow many people, such as herself, to get ahead. Jakeline plans to invest the money that she is requesting in the purchase of beauty products, since she likes to have a good quantity of stock to sell at a higher price, whatever the needs of her customers may be.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase suppply of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of products and a display case for the store

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo César (29), quien es fotógrafo, y de su hija Yanely de 9 años.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de fotografías al instante en su puesto ubicado en un centro comercial de su ciudad. El trabajo le gusta porque es fácil, pues consiste en tomar fotografías de distintos tamaños a sus clientes y revelarlas al momento para los fines que ellos deseen. Asimismo, vende celulares y accesorios para celular en el mismo puesto, es por esta razón que está muy satisfecha, puesto que obtiene muy buenas ganancias por ambos negocios, ya que muchas veces los clientes en la espera de las fotos ven los celulares y sus accesorios y se animan a comprarle. 
Para el futuro, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, pues ya le falta espacio; también quiere contar con un ayudante, ya que el trabajo lo hace con su esposo, pero ambos no se dan abasto.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando y progresar en la vida. Janet tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en el arreglo de su impresora de fotos, también comprará más cargadores y accesorios para celular.
texts.en:
Janet is 28 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband, Cesar (29), who is a photographer, and her daughter Yanley, who is 9. For four years she has been offering an instant photo service in her locale located in a mall in her city. She likes the work because it is easy. It is made up of taking different sized pictures of her clients and developing them right away for whatever reason they need them. She also sells cell phones and cell phone accesories in the same locale. For this reason she is very satisfied, since she gets good profit from both businesses. Many clients, while they are waiting for their pictures, see the cellphones and the accesories and they decide to buy them. For the future, she plans to grow her business, since she's already in need of space. She also wants to have an assistant, since she does the work with her husband, but the two of them can't keep up. This is the third loan she has had with MFP and she is very grateful with all of those people who make it possible for her to access credit that will allow her to keep on working and progressing in life. Janet is planning on investing the money she is asking for in fixing her photo printer. She will also buy more chargers and cell phone accesories.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of her photo printer

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Rafael (57), quine es transportista, y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos: Jacqueline (22) y Jhon (17).

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado según la temporada, tanto para hombres como mujeres. El negocio le gusta mucho porque lo hace sola y en este tiempo ha logrado captar buena cantidad de clientes, entre amigos y conocidos que le compran constantemente al crédito. También lleva mercadería a una zona minera donde tiene bastante demanda, además sabe que tiene gran capacidad de persuasión que le permite convencer a sus compradores respecto a los que les queda bien o no. La rentabilidad de su negocio se da porque la ropa y zapatos que vende los adquiere en la ciudad a precio cómodo. Es por eso que Juana está muy satisfecha, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es continuar en este rubro y para más adelante instalar un negocio en algún puesto de un centro comercial.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda obtener el crédito para trabajar y progresar. Juana tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues tiene muchos pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Juana, 45, lives in her own home accompanied by her husband Rafael, 57, who works in transportation, and their 2 children Jacqueline, 22, and Jhon, 17. For 3 years she has sold clothing and shoes according to the season, for men as well as women. She likes this business very much because she does it on her own. Over time she has managed to attract a large number of customers, including friends and acquaintances who are constantly buying from her on credit. In addition she takes her merchandise to a mining area where there is substantial demand. She knows that she has a great capacity for persuasion which allows her to convince her customers with respect to whether an item looks good on them or not. Her business is profitable because she acquires the clothing and shoes that she sells in a city at a low price. For this reason Juana is very satisfied, since she can help her husband with the household expenses. Her main wish is to continue in this line of work, and, in the future, to have a business set up in a stall in a commercial center. This is the first time that she has had a loan from MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who are making it possible for her to obtain the loan and to progress. Juana is planning to use the money to buy a large quantity of merchandise, since she has many orders to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy clothing)

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Desde hace catorce años, en el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Yessenia se ha caracterizado por tener su propia pulpería donde ofrece variedad de productos comestibles y también ofrece variedad de especies.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos y las especies como salsa de tomate, salsa inglesa, mostaza, vinagre, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar con sus ventas en su localidad.
texts.en:
For fourteen years, Yessenia has run her own grocery story in the Retail Market, offering a range of food products and a variety of condiments. She is now requesting a loan to use specifically to buy such products and condiments, such as catsup, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, vinegar, and others. She hopes that her loan will be granted, to thus continue selling in that location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge M. M., tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor  prioridad. Ellos tienen 23,21 y 17 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar un lote y poder sembrar granos básicos, tubérculos y plátano. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al terreno para poder darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de granos básicos, los tubérculos y la siembra de plátanos.  No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jorge tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura y está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en esta nueva oportunidad que se le presenta. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge M. M., 46, is married and has 3 children who are his main priority. They are 23, 21, and 17 years old. He wants a loan to buy a lot where he can grow basic grains, root vegetables and bananas. His idea is to maintain the land so it will produce a good harvest of basic grains, root vegetables and bananas. This is not the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very pleased with the ease of payments that they provide. Jorge has many years of experience in agriculture and is sure that he will do very well with this new opportunity. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a lot where he can cultivate root vegetables, basic grains and bananas

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Progresando”  está conformada por 17 integrantes,en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité se encuentran desarrollando sus actividades con mucho esfuerzo y empeño.
Este comité  se encuentra en pleno desarrollo con mucho trabajo para llevar a cabo todos los objetivos de manera integral para todas.
Se pudo hablar con la  Sra . Mirian A.  posee un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa en el centro de la ciudad, ella surte sus mercaderías del  mercado de Asunción donde viaja cada semana para abastecerse de sus mercaderías. Ella vende ademas jugos naturales, tiene clientela formadas con el ingreso que ella lo realiza día a día ayuda al marido para la alimentación de la familia..
Ademas ella posee un objetivo la de mejorar y ampliar su pequeño negocio para  ello piensa trabajar mucho con el comité y así lograr su propósito.
A continuación se presentan las actividades aque se dedica cada integrante de los comite.
1
Mirian A.

texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Progresando” is formed by 17 members in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members are developing their activities with a lot of effort and perseverance. This group is in full swing with a lot of work to do to complete all of their objectives in a comprehensive manner. Mirian A. has a small stand where she sells clothing in the center of the city. She stocks her store with merchandise from Asunción where she travels each week to buy merchandise, and she also sells natural juices. She has regular customers. With the income that she gets from this activity each day she helps her husband feed her family. Her goal is to improve and expand her small business. To do this she has been working with the group, and in this way she hopes to achieve her goal. Below the activities of each other member of the group are presented: 1 Mirian A. clothing sales 2 Delia O. Manicurist 3 Edith V. cosmetics sales 4 Eva R. clothing sales 5 Mirian R. clothing sales 6 Celsa P. the sale of meals 7 Perla L. cosmetics sales 8 Mercedes Carismo hairdresser 9 Maria Sixta D. the sale of cleaning products 10 Marcelina M. ice cream sales 11 Lucia D. cosmetics sales 12 Monica M. the sale of sewing supplies 13 Augusta P. clothing sales 14 Lourdes Segovia cosmetics sales 15 Margarita Gonzalez bread sales 16 Guillermina F. clothing sales 17 Meliza C. telephone operator

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy uniforms of all types for primary and secondary students, shirts, pants and skirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Carlos Gerald

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce de León, el caballero Carlos M. se desempeña como maestro de primaria en un pequeño colegio del municipio con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y beneficiar a su hijo por medio del mejoramiento de su nivel de vida por la reconstrucción de su vivienda.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillos, zinc, perlines, cemento para mejoramiento de la vivienda y la elaboración de un curto para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida tanto a su cónyuge como a su hijo que tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce de Leon, Carlos M. works as a primary school teacher in a small public school, in order to support his family and improve things for his child through a better life achieved by renovating his house. He is requesting a loan to purchase building materials, such as bricks, zinc, purlins, and cement, in order to improve his house and to build a room, to provide better living conditions for his wife and child, who are in great need of such improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, zinc, purlins, cement

loans.name: Martha Ryder

texts.es: Martha Ryder tiene 36 años, esta mujer es una muy responsable y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de gaseosas, jugos, refrescos naturales. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que ella se esfuerza para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son lo más importantes para ella, pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles pero esto no la detuvo a seguir adelante con este negocio, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer el servicio de costura pues no le proporcionaba los ingresos necesarios. Ella quiere para un futuro que sus hijos logren obtener estabilidad en sus vidas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  jugos en caja, gaseosas y las frutas para la elaboración de refrescos naturales.
texts.en:
Martha Ryder is 36 years old and a responsible woman with two dependent children. She sells sodas, juices, and natural beverages. Martha has been in this business for more than four years and strives to support her two children because they are her most important priority. Starting her business was difficult but this did not deter her from succeeding in her business. Previously she offered sewing services, but this activity did not provide her with sufficient income. In the future, she hopes her children will achieve stability in their lives. The loan she is questing will be used to buy boxed juices, sodas, and fruit for making natural soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boxed juices, sodas, and fruit

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Juan Carlos, tiene 24 años y es soltero. El socio Juan Carlos forma parte del banco comunal “SOL DE ORO” de la Asociación Arariwa. El socio Juan Carlos es carpintero de profesión y trabaja en la empresa privada “PANTIGOSO”, ya son cuatro años que trabaja como carpintero y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Juan Carlos desea tener su propio taller de carpintería, Juan Carlos esta implementando poco a poco su taller, él actualmente cuenta con herramientas básicas pero necesita herramientas modernas.  El socio Juan Carlos requiere el préstamo para comprar varias herramientas, como por ejemplo ruteadora que cuesta 300 soles, lijadora que cuesta 250 soles y un taladro inalámbrico que cuesta 150 soles.      
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 24 years old, single, and a member of the Communal Bank “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is a carpenter by profession and works at a private company called “Pantigoso”. Juan Carlos has already worked four years as a carpenter and is doing very well because of the effort he puts into his business. He wants to open his own carpentry shop and he is gradually establishing it. Juan Carlos currently uses basic tools, but he is in need of modern equipment. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy tools. For example, he will buy a router that costs 300 soles, a sander that costs 250 soles, and a cordless drill that costs 150 soles. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete all of his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Margarita Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Margarita R. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesillos en el municipio de Nagarote donde se desempeña en la venta de estos deliciosos quesillos que están compuestos por quesillo, tortilla, cebolla y crema.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha necesitado esta mejora y es por este motivo que ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio de la mejora de su vivienda
texts.en:
Señora Margarita R. makes and sells tortillas filled with melted cheese in the city of Nagarote. She makes them with cheese, tortillas, onion, and cream. She is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of construction materials to improve her living conditions. She has needed this improvement for a long time and this is why she hopes to receive this loan. She wants to improve her and her family's living conditions by improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ivette Sorayda

texts.es: Doña Ivette es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, su esposo trabaja en la compañía movistar, desde hace cuatro años vende pues tiene una pequeña pulpería que , inicio vendiendo helados, luego fresco, gaseosas y ahora golosinas, granos básicos, pero no ha logrado un inventario grande debido a que no tiene el capital suficiente para aumentar su venta es por eso que opto al financiamiento para poder comprar granos, básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, lácteos, y comenzar a captar clientes. Lo que mas desea es poder crecer y llegar a tener su propia casa donde pueda tener una mejor privacidad,  ya que habitan en casa de sus padres lo que espera lograr a largo plazo , junto con Afodenic que gracias a este préstamo iniciara una mejor etapa.
texts.en:
Doña Ivette is a hardworking woman. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband works for Movistar (a cellular phone provider in Latin America). Four years ago, she started a small store where she sells ice cream. She later added cold drinks, sodas, candy, and basic grains. However, she has not able to achieve a large enough inventory because she lacks sufficient capital to increase her sales. For this reason, she is choosing to seek financing to buy basic grains, candy, sodas, and dairy products so that she can attract customers. What she desires most is to grow her business and have a house of her own so that she can have more privacy. Ivette currently lives with her parents and hopes to succeed in the long term. With the loan from AFODENIC, she hopes to begin improvement in the next stage of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa”  está conformada por 15 integrantes,en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividad independiente y productiva de forma para ayudar a toda su familia.

Para comentar un poco mas sobre el comité se puede hablar de la Sra. Mirian , quien tiene 2 hijo es vendedora(comestibles, frutas, golosinas, dulces y otros) ambulante sale por la mañana a hacer sus ventas en la zona del su barrio recorriendo los negocios  y vuelve a su casa por la tarde. Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarias. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Se detalla las actividades de cada una:
1
Mirian C.

texts.en:
The “Oñondivepa” Committee consists of 15 members who live in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of them have developed independent and productive activities as a way of helping their families.

One cannot talk about this Committee without mentioning Sra. Mirian. She has a two year old son and works as a traveling street merchant who sells food, fruit, sweets, candy, and other items. In the morning, she sells her products while walking through her neighborhood and then returns home in the afternoon. Mirian exhibits great patience day after day despite having to take care of the household chores and do everything she can as a single mother to help her children get ahead. She lives in a small house made of unstable materials. Mirian works in this manner in order to cover the household expenses and keep her two children in school.

The details of each member’s activities are listed below:

1. Mirian C. – Empanada sales 2. Nathalia R. - Empanada sales 3. Paula G. – Handmade clothing 4. Maria V. G. – Domestic employee 5. Vicenta Lopez – Teacher 6. Lorena Gonzalez - Empanada sales 7. Pamela G. – Recycling sales 8. Mirian M. – Clothing sales 9. Elva L. – Food sales 10. Liz B. – Cosmetic sales 11. Maria O. – Clothing sales 12. Maria Carde – Clothing sales 13. Natalia C. – Domestic employee 14. Rosana O. – Cheese sales 15. Ernesta L. – Recycling sales

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es:
Anavita C. A., tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor  prioridad. Ellos tienen 23,21 y 17 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar un lote y poder sembrar granos básicos como los frijoles, maíz, además de sembrar plátano. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al terreno para poder darle el adecuado mantenimiento a la siembra de granos básicos, y la siembra de plátanos, para cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias.  No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Anavita tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura, sobre todo en la siembra de granos básicos, ella está segura de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo proyecto.Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Anavita C. A. is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are her highest priority. They are 23, 21, and 17 years of age. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a plot of land for growing beans and corn, as well as bananas. Her plan is to maintain the land so that she can adequately care for her crops until they are ready to be harvested and sold so that she can generate more income. This is not the first time she has received a loan from FUDECOSUR and she has been very happy with all of the services that have been provided. Doña Anavita has several years of experience in agriculture, mostly growing basic grains. She expects to do well in her next project. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. She also hopes to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land for growing beans, corn, and bananas

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena forma parte del Banco Comunal Damas de Éxito, este banco esta formado por 19 socias  muy unidas entre sí ya que se agruparon en busca de mejores dias para ellas y sus familias, el banco esta situado en la provincia de Manabí región costa del Ecuador muy visitada por sus hermosas playas que ofrece al turista nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia nos comentó que es de profesión modista lleva  20  años  ejerciendo esta actividad gracias a estudios en academias y cursos de capacitación impartidos en la ciudad de Portoviejo,    vive sólo con su  hija de los cuatro que tuvo ya que los otros son casados y viven independientes  a sus  51 años  sigue trabajando muy duro para salir adelante y fue gracias a una amiga que se enteró de los benenficios que brinda la Fundación Espoir desde entonces es socia activa de éste banco en el que lleva ya varios ciclos.

Con el préstamo solicitado podrá invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, encajes, plumón, etc.   de diferentes tipos tanto para elaborar toldos, sabanas y edredones que realiza solo bajo pedido como para la confección de ropa en general y para ello en su casa  tiene un pequeño taller donde trabaja sola y dispone de  dos maquinas de coser. 

Maria Elena tiene como sueño comprar unas vitrinas para vender cosas de bazar y  una maquina de coser idnustrial para realizar más rapido sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas de Éxito” (Women of Success), which consists of 19 members who are very close and have banded together to improve the future for themselves and their families. This Communal Bank is located in the province of Manabí, which lies in the coastal region of Ecuador and is frequently visited by foreign and domestic tourists for its beautiful beaches.

Maria Elena says that she has been a professional seamstress for 20 years. She pursued this profession as a result of her schoolwork and training classes she took in the city of Portoviejo. Maria Elena lives alone with one of her four children. The others are married and live independently. At 51 years of age, she works very hard to get ahead. Thanks to a friend who heard about the benefits provided by Fundación ESPOIR, she decided to become a member of this Communal Bank and has participate in several loan cycles.

With this loan, she will buy fabric, thread, lace, feathers, and other types of material to make awnings, bed sheets, and quilts that can be purchased only by request as well as general clothing that she sews. She has a small shop in her house where she works alone and has two sewing machines.

Maria Elena hopes to buy two display cases for selling bazaar items and an industrial sewing machine so that she can complete her work faster.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cattle for fattening

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes P. es una dama muy trabajadora del municipio de Nagarote que se dedica arduamente a laborar con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos ya que es madre soltera y también tiene a su deber el cuidado de su amada madre.
Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto lo necesita. Entre los materiales que ella comprará se encuentran piedra cantera, arena, hierro y cemento para levantar las paredes de su vivienda y así culminar esta obra.
texts.en:
Señora María Mercedes P. is a very hard-working woman who lives in the city of Nagarote. She works hard with the goal of supporting her family, which is made up of her three children. She is a single mother and also cares for her beloved mother. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials to improve her home and therefore offer better living conditions to her family that needs them so much. Among the matierals that she will buy are quarry stone, sand, iron, and cement to raise the walls of her home and complete its construction.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construcion materials

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 46 años de edad, tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de ropa. Esta empresaria tiene créditos con Fundación León 2000, pues ha sido de gran beneficio para ella pues ha sabido administrar muy bien su negocio. Ella ofrece sus productos a diferentes personas, ella tiene mucha experiencia en su trabajo pues le da la libertad de ofrecer sus productos en diferentes ambientes y comunidades obteniendo así muy buenas ventas. Ella sueña con seguir proporcionando el alimento diario a su familia. es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento que es destinado para la compra de ropa en general.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 46 years old and sells clothes for a living. This entrepreneur has received loans from Fundación León 2000, which have helped her to manage her business well. She offers her products to different types of people and has extensive experience in this type of work. Since she has the freedom to offer products in different settings and communities, she is able to generate good sales. Her dream is to continue putting food on the table every day for her family. For this reason, Maria is requesting a loan to buy clothing in general.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa, D. 52 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. sus 4 hijos; Jessica (23), Javier (18), Jonathan (17) y Judith (12). Esta familia, en unión, busca salir adelante cada día.

Cuando se quedó sola y tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos, no dudó en trabajar en lo que mejor sabía hacer, cocinar, lo hizo y nadie la detuvo. Ya han pasado varios años desD. que empezó a vender chicharrón (cerdo aderezado y frito), el cual prepara en su casa para después venderlo en la calle, donD. instala un pequeño puesto. Este negocio le es muy rentable, pues le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas, ya que tiene varios comensales que se acercaban a comprar su platillo. Es por esta razón que después D. 20 años ha continuado en el negocio, ahora ya cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos y pueden vender sin problemas. 
Siendo una madre luchadora, que no se detiene ante ningún problema, ya tiene pensado para el futuro empezar otro negocio D. venta D. comida, paralelo al que tiene en la actualidad.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está infinitamente agradecida con todas aquellas personas que D. una u otra manera hace posible que reciba el crédito para seguir trabajando. Por otro lado, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo D. su grupo, ya que todos son muy responsables con el pago D. sus cuotas. Elisa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. una salchipapera (cocina móvil donD. fríe papas y salchichas), pues tiene pensado en las mañanas seguir vendiendo su chicharrón y por la noche salchipapas.
texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her four children: Jessica (age 23), Javier (age 18), Jonathan (age 17), and Judith (age 12). As a family, they work together to find a way to get ahead each day.

When she had to start raising her children by herself, Elisa did not hesitate to begin work in what she does best – cooking. No one was able to dissuaD. her. She started her business several years ago selling chicharrón (seasoned fried pork), which she prepares at home and then sells on the street from a small vending stand. This business is very profitable because she generates good earnings from having several customers pass by to purchase a meal. Elisa has remained in business for twenty years and now has the assistance of her children so that she can continue to sell without problems. She is a determined mother who will not let any problem stop her. Her plans for the future incluD. opening another food business in addition to the one she has today.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Elisa is infinitely grateful to everyone who maD. it possible for her to receive loans to continue her work. She is also very pleased with the work of her Communal Bank, who have all been very responsible in completing their payments. Elisa will use the money to by a “salchipapera” (a mobile cart equipped for selling fried potatoes and sausages) so that she can continue selling chicharrón in the morning and then salchipapas in the evening.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mobile cart for selling "salchipapas"

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Norlan C. se dedica a la actividad de molino brindando el servicio de molino en el municipio de Nagarote donde muchos clientes llegan a moler el maíz, la carne, el cacao, entre otros comestibles.
Está interesado en mejorar las condiciones de su actividad y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de un motor y un capacitador, para dar mejor atención a sus cliente, con menos consumo de energía, obteniendo un mejor rendimiento a menor costo y mayores ganancias. Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para así mejorar las condiciones del molino y poder continuar satisfaciendo todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Norlan C. has a milling service in the city of Nagarote where many clients come to have him mill corn, meat, cocoa, and other food items. He is interested in improving his mill's conditions so he is requesting a loan so he can buy a motor and a capacitator. He will be able to give better service to his clients and will consume less energy and will have a better output at a lower cost and higher profit. He hopes to receive this loan so he can improve his mill's conditions and continue satisfying all of his clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor and a capacitator for his mill

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Adrian Antonio I. O., tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el Barrio la conejita, vive con su pareja, ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 12 y 8 años de edad ellos son estudiantes de Primaria. Dentro de los planes de la familia esta la compra de un lote para el establezimiento de cosecha de citrico.

Ellos se dedican desde hace 15 años y dentro de los problemas que han tenido a sido la falta de financiamiento y apoyo de las empresas a este sector, es por esta razon que solicita de este credito para la compra de materiales agricolas que le brinden a sus tierras un mantenimiento optimo que ayude al excelente crecimiento de la producciön. El apoyo que se le puediera brindar a la familia I. les seria de mucho beneficio para futuras inversiones y/o planes programados para el buen beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Adrian Antonio I. O. is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Conejita with his partner. They have two children, ages 12 and 8, who are elementary school students. The plans for his family include buying a plot of land for establishing a citrus orchard.

Adrian has been in business for 15 years but he has encountered problems due to a lack of financing to support his ventures in the agricultural sector. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies so that he can provide optimal maintenance to his farmland and boost production. The assistance provided to the I. family has been of great benefit to them and for their future investments and plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies to increase his crop production

loans.name: Vladimir Ilichn

texts.es:
Vladimir, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y es guía espiritual. Vladimir tiene una tienda de servicio técnico de celulares movibles en el centro comercial “El Paraiso” de la ciudad del Cusco. Vladimir también hace ceremonias como dar ofrendas a la tierra (pachamanca) acompañado de turistas. Una sesión al turista le cuesta 50 dólares para apreciar la ceremonia. Vladimir requiere el crédito para comprar accesorios de celulares móviles.
    
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Vladimir is 34 years old, has two children, and is a spiritual guide. He works as a service technician at a mobile phone store that he manages in the commercial district of El Paraiso in the city of Cusco. Vladimir also conducts ceremonies for tourists in which burnt offerings are presented to the earth. In order for tourists to view this ceremony, he charges $50 for each session. He is requesting a loan to buy mobile phone accessories.

Vladimir is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar se dedica a la compra de ropa variada, los cuales el señor distribuye de forma ambulante. Julio dice que el crédito lo necesita para diversificar sus productos, comprar más y lógicamente recuperar más. El recorre todo los días las calles bajo este inmenso sol, logrando obtener nuevos clientes. Pues tiene hijos y familia que mantener como todo padre responsable que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus seres queridos. Su mayor sueño continua siendo tener una tienda en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio Cesar sells various types of clothing as a traveling street vendor. He needs a loan in order to diversify his products and wants to buy more so that he can earn more. Julio wanders through the streets every day under the intense sun looking to acquire new customers. He has children and family that he has to support, so like any responsible father, he is concerned about the welfare of his loved ones. His greatest wish is to open a shop at the new market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove, two sets of tables and chairs, a set of cookware, copper pots, and groceries

loans.name: Tomasito

texts.es:
Tomasito tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío San Pablo Escurre, del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga en su moto carguera, usualmente carga fruta, leña o ganado por los diversos caseríos de Olmos. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad, tanto para el como para sus clientes, ya que le provee los ingresos que necesita para solventar sus gastos personales y a la vez ayuda a sus vecinos a solucionar sus problemas de transporte, ya que la mayoría de caseríos del distrito quedan muy alejados uno del otro y no cuentan con movilidad estable.

El contínuo uso brindado a su vehículo y los accidentados caminos que tiene que recorrer a diario han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Tomasito es un joven trabajador y muy responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos lo estiman mucho y lo consideran una persona que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Tomasito is 30 years old and single. He lives together with his parents in the small village of San Pablo Escurre in the Olmos district which is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For a living, he runs a delivery service. Usually he hauls fruit or wool or livestock to the various villages in Olmos. This business is very useful both for him and for his customers. The business provides the income needed to pay for his personal expenditures and also helps his neighbors solve their shipping problems as the majority of the villages in the district are located far away from each other and are not connected by regular transportation. Regular use on rugged roads has resulted in his only vehicle requiring several urgent repairs. It is for this reason that he has needed to solicit his first loan from Edpyme Alternative. He is asking for 1500 Nuevos soles in order to repair and maintain his vehicle. Tomasito is a hard working, responsible young man. His neighbors and acquaintances admire him greatly and consider him a person who is always there to help when it is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs to repair and maintain a delivery vehicle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, D. 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. sus dos hijos; Cynthia (22) y Cristóbal (14). Aunque está separada D. su esposo, su hija mayor L. ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

DesD. hace 10 años se dedica a L. venta D. ropa, le gusta su trabajo porque lo pueD. realizar en cualquier momento que disponga D. tiempo libre, es tranquilo y venD. a conocidos y amigos que le hacen pedidos y le pagan al crédito. Además obtiene muy buenas ganancias que le ayudan a sustentar su hogar, junto con L. pensión D. su ex esposo y L. ayuda que recibe D. su hija le va muy bien. Asimismo, es una mujer muy carismática y por eso le es muy fácil vender e interactuar con las personas. Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. ropa, en sociedad con su hija, y ya tiene pensada L. ubicación, será en un centro comercial D. L. zona por donD. vive.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, ya que podrá progresar y concretar sus sueños. María tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en L. compra D. mayor cantidad D. ropa para poder completar los pedidos que tiene por cumplir.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her two children: Cynthia (22) and Cristóbal (14). Even though she is separated from her husband, her daughter helps her with the household expenses. She has been selling clothes for 10 years and she likes the job because she can do it whenever she has free time; it is relaxed work and she sells to acquaintances and friends that place orders and pay on credit. She makes good profits that help her support the household, and with the pension from her ex-husband and the help from her daughter, she does really well. She is also very charismatic and it is easy for her to sell and interact with people. In the future, she plans to setup a clothing store, in association with her daughter; she even has a location in mind, in a shopping center close to where she lives. This is the third loan she has with MFP and is very grateful with all the people that make her loan possible, since she will be able to get ahead and fulfill her dreams. María plans to invest the money from the loan in buying a bigger quantity of clothes to fulfill her open orders.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus 2 hermanos. Cada día trabaja y se esfuerza por ser una mejor persona y próspera.

Desde hace un año se dedica a la atención en un centro de llamadas telefónicas (locutorio) ubicado en una galería comercial, aunque no es propio ella se esmera por atender muy bien y hacer buenos clientes, ya que sabe que la clave del éxito es la buena atención. Trabaja de lunes a sábado, durante todo el día, y el sueldo que recibe le alcanza para poder ayudar en los gastos de su casa. Le gusta mucho este trabajo porque en la galería donde labora se ha hecho muchas amigas y además interactúa bastante con el público asistente. 
Paralelamente vende cosméticos de una marca reconocida, siendo sus amigas del trabajo sus principales clientes, esta actividad que le genera ingresos económicos adicionales y a pesar de su juventud tiene muchas aspiraciones para salir adelante, especialmente tener su propio centro de llamadas y ser independiente.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda obtener el crédito para concretar sus planes. Rosa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de accesorios para celular, los cuales planea vender en el locutorio, pues se ha dado cuenta que tienen bastante demanda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old and lives in her parent’s house along with her two brothers. Every day she works and tries to become a better, successful person. For the past year she has earned a living in a “locutorio” which is an establishment containing a number of telephone booths for public use, located in a commercial shopping center. Even though she is not the owner, she takes great pains to attend to her customers as she knows that the key to success is customer service. She works all day Monday through Saturday and the salary she receives is used to help with household costs. She likes this work a lot because in the shopping center where she works she has made many friends and also interacts a lot with the public. In addition, she sells well-known cosmetics mostly to her friends at work. This activity generates supplementary income. As she is young, she has great aspirations to be successful and hopes one day to have her own “locutrio” and be independent. This is her third loan with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people who have made it possible for her to obtain loans and help her plans materialize. Rosa is thinking of using the loan to buy cellular phone accessories to sell in the “locutorio” as she has noted they are in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes P. S., nació en Santo Tomas municipio del Departamento del Atlántico,  donde aun vive y goza del cariño de sus habitantes,  que la llaman  “ la Seño”  por el gran número de niños que han estado en su proyecto escolar y que hoy son  adultos, profesionales, padres de familia, no dejan de apodarla como cuando ellos eran niños.  Para ella Santo Tomas es un municipio de gente que siempre quiere ayudarse entre sí y a sus forasteros; les gusta la fiesta por eso realizan el Carnaval Intermunicipal del Atlántico que integra a todo el Departamento; pero  dice que más allá del  baile el Tomasino (su gentilicio)  es  un ser humano muy estudioso y con una gran capacidad de superación.
María Mercedes tiene al lado de su vivienda, unas instalaciones donde se dedica a cuidar y preparar a  niños  para que superen los niveles  de jardín, prejardin, transición y donde también desarrolla actividades de refuerzo y complementación de estudiantes que le llevan sus padres, para  ser ayudados a superar logros educativos a través de su programa de tareas dirigidas. Cuando ella inició esta actividad no había terminando su bachillerato y lo hizo ayudando a niños de sus vecinas sin cobrarle dinero, pero ellos llevaban los pupitres donde sentarse; poco a poco con el nivel de progreso de estos niños,  muchas madres tomasinas  requerían de sus servicios;  fue así como decidió  con la ayuda de ellos, ampliar los salones y  adecuar lo que hoy son 3 salones, donde los niños aprenden en un mejor espacio. Por eso en aras de continuar brindándole un mejor ambiente formativo a los niños, solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 que  invertirá en adecuaciones de sus instalaciones como: repellar paredes, cambiar la cubierta, adecuar las zonas húmedas, e invertir en meriendas económicas y sanas para ofrecer a sus pequeños.
Su sueño a mediano plazo es ampliar la cobertura y entrar al sistema educativo formal, para lo cual se está preparando, pues aunque no tiene hijos biológicos, su vocación maternal y educadora,  está volcada especialmente  hacia los niños y los que están  en su proyecto de escuela, no son la excepción; en este sentido ella estimula la finalización de sus niveles integrándolos con sus padres, mediante pequeñas ceremonias de cumplimiento de logros, con la que todos se sienten muy felices de su progreso, especialmente “La Seño” como todos la conocen en Santo Tomás.
texts.en:
María Mercedes P. S. was born in the municipality of Santo Tomás, department of Atlántico, where she still lives and enjoys the affection of its inhabitants; they call her “La Seño” (short for “Señora” or “Señorita”; commonly associated with a teacher but with respect and affection) because of the great number of children that have participated in her school project and are now adults, professionals, parents who continue use her nickname as when they were children. To her, Santo Tomas is a municipality of people willing to help each other and even outsiders; they like festivals and that is why they have the Carnaval Intermunicipal del Atlántico that integrates the entire Department; but beyond dancing, the “Tomasino” (as people from Santo Tomas are called) is a human being who likes to study and has great capacity to improve herself or himself. María Mercedes has a facility next to her house where she takes care and prepares children to get through pre-kinder, kinder, and transition period; she also conducts activities to reinforce and compliment the work of students brought by their parents; the students are coached to exceed their school achievements through guided work. She had not finished high school when she started this line of work, and she begun by helping the neighbor’s children without charging them, but they brought their own desks to sit on; little by little, with the level of progress achieved by these children, many “tomasina” mothers sought her services; for this reason and with their help, she decided to expand the classrooms and she equipped what are now 3 classrooms, where the children learn in a better space. In the interest of continuing to bring a better learning environment, she is requesting a loan of $2.000.000 that she will invest in improvements of her facilities, such as: plaster walls, change roof cover, accommodate ecological areas and buy inexpensive and healthy snacks for her children. Her mid-term dream is to expand the coverage and enter the educational system officially, for which she is preparing; even though she has no biological children, her calling as a mother and a teacher is completely dedicated to the children, and the ones in her school project are no exception. She stimulates the completion of the different levels by integrating the children with their parents through small ceremonies for fulfilled achievements, in which all participants feel happy with the progress, especially “La Seño”, as she is known by everybody in Santo Tomás.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve classroom facilities (walls, roofs, ecological areas) and buy inexpensive and healthy snacks for the children

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene más de 4 años en este negocio. A pesar de lo cansado que es porque tiene que levantarse muy temprano, ya que además tiene otro trabajo labora como conserje en un colegio público, y tenía que buscar el medio para generar más ingresos a su familia porque se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana para dejar todas las cosas hechas en su hogar, ir al colegio a realizar su trabajo y después salir a vender sus productos. Asa es la vida de Maria, pero no la desanima pues todos los días ella misma se da valor. Es por eso que recurre a este financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y no quedar mal con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel works selling general groceries, which she has been doing for over 4 years. In spite of the weariness created by getting up very early, Maria also has another job as the receptionist at a public school. She had to look for the way to earn more income for her family so she gets up at 5 every morning to do everything around the house, go to school to do her job and then afterwards leaves to sell her products. This is Maria's life, but it doesn't get her down as each day she herself gives it value. It is for this reason that she requires this loan, to purchase primary materials. She dreams of expanding her business and not being bad with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, de 27 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Jodaline (25) y de su pequeña hija Xiomara (3).

Desde que era muy joven empezó a trabajar en diferentes oficios, ya que siempre quería ayudar a sus padres, y cuando formó su familia no dudó en seguir buscando una manera honrada de mantenerla. Es así que aprendió a manejar y empezó a trabajar, desde hace 4 años, ofreciendo el servicio de taxi, al principio lo hacia con un auto alquilado, pero hace un año logró comprar su auto propio. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es dueño de su tiempo y labora tranquilo, especialmente en “horas punta” (de mayor demanda y tráfico) cuando hay más personas que requieran de sus servicios. William está muy satisfecho porque este trabajo le genera muy buenas ganancias que le permiten brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, y como es un hombre joven, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, para el futuro tiene planeado comprar otro auto y brindarlo en alquiler para generarse otros ingresos económicos.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda obtener el crédito para seguir progresando. William tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la revisión técnica (mandato gubernamental) de su vehículo, ya que debe cumplir con lo dispuesto por la ley para seguir trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
William, 27, lives in his own house together with his partner Jodaline (2) and his little daughter Xiomara (3). When William was very young he began working in different jobs, as he always wanted to help his parents. When he started his own family he didn't waste any time in looking for an honourable way to maintain it. In this way William learnt to drive and 4 years ago started work offering a taxi service. At the beginning he used a rented car, but a year ago was able to buy his own car. William likes his job very much, as he is the boss of his time and works peacefully, especially in rush hour (the greatest demand and traffic) when there are more people that require his services. William is very satisfied because his work generates very good earnings that allow him to give his family a good quality of life. As he is a young man with a great desire to move forward, in the future he plans to buy another car and rent it out to generate more earnings. This is the fourth loan he has had with MFP and he is very thankful for all the people that have made it possible for him to obtain the loan to continue his progress. William plans to invest the money he is seeking in a technical revision (government mandated) of his car, which he must comply with as the law stipulates so he can continue working without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Technical assessment of car

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Orlando Antonio L. T., tiene 27 años de edad vive en el barrio el Eden es acompañado y su señora se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y la agricultura dentro de los planes de la familia esta la remodelacion de una habitacion de la casa. Ellos tienen 5 años de dedicarse a la agricultura (cultivo de piña).
Dentro de los principales problemas ha los que se han enfrentado han sido la falta de apoyo de las financieras a este rubro, ellos pudieron comenzar su trabajo gracias al apoyo economico de sus padres, dentro de los planes que tienen a futuro estan la diversificación de los tierras de los cultivos en siembros rentables como cafe y platano, es para esto que solicitaron de un prestamo para la compra de material vegetativo y fertilizante que ayuden a la produccion a un crecimiento optimo que garantize la calidad de la cosecha y la buena venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Orlando Antonio L. T. is 27 years old and lives in the suburb of Eden. He is accompanied by his wife and they work around the house and in agriculture. Among the family's plans is the remodelling of one room in their house. They have been working in agriculture cultivating pineapples for 5 years. Among the principle problems that they have faced has been the lack of financial support in the area. Orlanda and his wife were able to start work thanks to the support of their parents. Among the plans that they have for the future they plan to diversify the land the cultivate in other profitable crops such as coffee and plantains, and for this reason they are seeking a loan to buy vegetation and fertiliser that will help production for optimum growth that will guarantee the quality of the harvest and the good sale of the same.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetation and fertiliser

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío El Médano del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la crianza y engorde de ganado vacuno, actualmente posee seis cabezas de ganado de las cuales aprovecha la leche que producen y también las engorda para poder venderlas a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso económico que le permita solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento familiar.

José desea mejorar la calidad de su ganado que ha sido disminuida por la temporada seca que afrontó la región, por este motivo quiere comprar alimento balanceado, pero como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

José es un joven muy estimado por las personas que lo conocen, ellos lo consideran una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He is single and lives together with his parents in the hamlet of El Médano in the Olmos district, located 2 hours and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was very young he has worked breeding and fattening cattle. He has 6 heads of cattle and makes use of the milk they product, and he also fattens them to sell to the business people that normally visit the zone where he lives. This business is the only source of income that allows him to cover his personal costs and help support his family. José wants to improve the quality of his cattle that have been a handicap because of the dry period that has hit the region. For this motive he wants to buy balanced feed but doesn't have the capital to do this. He has seen it necessary for the first time to seek a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles. José is highly regarded by those who know him, and they consider him a very responsible and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed to fatten cattle.

loans.name: Jamilet Del Rosario

texts.es: Jamilet tiene 37 años de edad, es una Señora empresaria que le gusta mucho su trabajo. Pues disfruta diariamente de su actividad como es la venta de ropa, por lo que tiene todo el espíritu de salir adelante. Ella inicio este negocio hace 25 años estableciendo pocos productos como es sandalias, ropa interior y ropa en general, la mayoría de sus vecinos estaban muy contentos, pues Jamilet siempre se ha destacado por saber relacionarse y aconsejar a sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer una variedad de productos. Sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jamilet is 37 years old and is an entrepreneurial woman who likes her work very much. She enjoys her work daily, which is selling clothes, because with all her spirit she wants to move forward. Jamilet started this business 25 years ago, establishing a few products such as sandals, underwear and clothes in general. The majority of her neighbours are very content because Jamilet has always made the effort to relate to others and to advise her customers. She is seeking a loan for the purchase of primary material to offer a variety of products. She dreams of improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Liberata

texts.es:
Liberata, es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el Distrito D. Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 56 años, es madre D. cinco hijos y uno todavía depenD. D. ella.
Liberata se dedica a la modistería (costura), esta actividad la realiza en su casa, es viuda. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desD. hace 9 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra D. materiales para lencería.
Ahora necesita un crédito D. 500 soles que será invertido en la compra D. materiales para su negocio y así cumplir con sus pedidos D. costura y tejido. La meta D. Liberata es poner un negocio D. confección y venta D. lencería en su casa.
texts.en:
Liberata is an enterprising woman who lives in Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 56 years old, is the mother of five children, and one is still dependent on her. Liberata works in dressmaking (sewing). She does this work in her house. She is a widow. She has been part of the “Las Dinámicas” ("Dynamic Women") communal bank for 9 years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of materials for lingerie. Now she needs a loan of 500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of materials for her business so she can fill her sewing and knitting orders. Liberata's goal is to have a business making and selling lingerie from her house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase materials for making clothing

loans.name: Los Lopez Group

texts.en:
The L. Group consists of three workers. One is Señora Felix Elena V. F., who began selling fruits and vegetables, such as sweet peppers, carrots, and onions, when she was 15 years old.  By these means, she raised her six children, who each help with the work, especially on days when Felix is sick; she often has problems with her heart and circulation.

The other members of the L. Group are Ana María López B., who stitches embroidery, and Terencio Margarito Martínez Hernández, who makes traditional shoes that he sells in the Masaya Market. Their goal collectively is to expand their work places and upgrade their machinery.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sicalvenses Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de 6 personas que se dedican a la crianza de ganado bovino, su residencia se encuentra a unos 20 kilometros de la ciudad de Momostenango, Totonicapán, actualmente cuentan con varios ganados pero necesitan aumentar de capital para la compra de pastos para el ganado, se han organizado estas personas ya que agrupandose logran obtener un prestamo con el objetivo de tener buenos ganados y asi poder venderlos con personas del lugar, y de esa manera podrán comercializar sus ganados con mayor frecuencia,actualmente tienen una rotación de venta de 6 meses sobre su capital asi también cuentan con otros oficios tales como lo es la confección de ropa de vestir, no se tiene mayores inconvenientes sobre la responsabilidad de pago,llevan alrededor de 13 años con la crianza de animales, con el financiamiento que obtendrán pueden obtener mejores ingresos economicos, asi también pueden ayudar en el desarrollo de la comunidad donde habitan.
texts.en:
This is a group of 6 people who raise cattle for a living. They live about 20 kilometers outside the city of Momostenango, Totonicapán. Currently they have a lot of cattle, but they need more capital to buy pasture. The members have organized themselves as a group because together they can obtain a loan that will allow them to have higher quality livestock that they can sell to locals. This way they will be able to sell their cattle with greater frequency. Currently, they have a six months sales rotation with their capital, which is also used for other trades like making clothing. They will not have problems with the repayment responsibilities. They have spent about 13 years raising animals. With the financing they will get through Kiva, they can receive greater revenues, which will allow them to help develop the community where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pasture for cattle

loans.name: Edwin Francisco

texts.es:
Edwin Francisco R. G., tiene la edad de 18 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos para granja, la idea es criar y engordar los pollos para luego venderlos, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Edwin Francisco desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa, además espera poder ayudarse para poder terminar con sus estudios. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Edwin Francisco R. G. is 18 years old, unmarried, and has no children. He is requesting a loan to buy and raise chickens. His idea is to raise and fatten the chickens to later sell; that way, he can get the best possible income from their sale. This is the first time he is taking out a loan through FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the resources they provide him. Edwin Francisco hopes that this business can help bring economic support to his home and also hopes that it will allow him to finish his studies. He wishes to provide his family with a better quality of life in the future and greater economic stability, and he hopes to continue to grow as a person and agricultural producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens for fattening

loans.name: Hector David

texts.es: Héctor tiene 60 años, es casado y vive con su esposa. La ubicación de su negocio es Wisquiliapa ya que anteriormente lo tenía ubicado en el centro del mercado, pero entraron a robar a su negocio, en su negocio que es una tienda de productos varios, es por eso que decidió establecerlo en su vivienda a pesar de esto, no se ha desanimado pues con la ayuda de Dios y los financiamiento que son importantes en su vida logro salir adelante. Su esposa ayuda e su negocio, pues la atención a los clientes la realizan juntos. El solicita este financiamiento con el fin de comprar productos necesarios para su actividad económica y que sus clientes le encargan. El sueña con obtener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Héctor is 60 years old and married. He lives with his wife. His business is located in Wisquiliapa. He previously had the business in the center of the market. People got in to rob his business, which is a store with various products. That is why he decided to establish his store in his house. In spite of this, he did not become discouraged. With God’s help and the loans, which are important to him, he was able to get ahead. His wife helps him in the business. They both wait on the customers together. He is requesting this loan in order to buy necessary products and products his customers order for his business. He dreams of getting his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucy Magaly

texts.es:
Lucy es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general en un mercado de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como transportista y los ingresos que percibe no son suficentes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio goza de buena acogida gracias a la calidad de servicio que brinda. Lucy deses ampliarlo con la compra de útiles escolares, pero, como no cuenta con capital para realizar esta acción, se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Lucy es una madre de familia reponsable, emprendedora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les garantice un futuro prometedor. En la imagen aparece junto a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 33 year old mother. She lives with her husband and their two children in the Olmos district, which is one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells general groceries in a market in her area. This business is a big help in supporting her family. Her husband is a truck driver, and his income is not enough to pay the family expenses. The business is well-received thanks to the quality of service she offers. Lucy wants to expand the business by purchasing school supplies. Because she does not have the money to do so, she saw the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 1,000 PEN to use to achieve her objective. Lucy is a responsible and hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to give her children a quality education, which will guarantee them a promising future. She appears in the photo with her youngest daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies to expand her business in the school season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro”  de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 23 años, es soltera: Ella estudia actualmente la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto superior “Antonio Lorena” del Cusco y esta cursando el cuarto semestre. Ella es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su carrera profesional.
