Karina nos cuenta que viaja los días lunes a la frontera de Perú con el país de Bolivia a traer mercadería como casacas, chompas y pantalones y después lo vende en el centro comercial de la calle Trinitarias los días martes y sábados, Karina requiere el crédito para comprar uniformes escolars y mochilas para esta campaña escolar que se acerca. Ya son varios ciclos que participa de los bancos comunales de la Asociación de Arariwa. 

La socia Maria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (La socia Karina en la fotografía esta acompañada de su enamorado).
texts.en:
Karina belongs to the Sol de Oro Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is 23 years old and single. She is currently studying the professional career of tourism in Antonio Lorena, an institute for higher learning in Cusco. She is in her fourth semester. She is a hard-working and enterprising young woman who is getting ahead in her professional career. Karina tells us that on Mondays she travels to Peru’s border with Bolivia to get merchandise like jackets, sweaters, and pants. Later, she sells them on Tuesday through Saturday in a commercial center on Trinitarias street. Karina needs the loan to buy school uniforms and backpacks for the approaching school season. She has participated in communal banks with the Arariwa Association for several cycles. Maria is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. (Karina is in the photograph with her sweetheart.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school uniforms and backpacks

loans.name: Kelly Azucena

texts.es:
La señora  KELY tiene 34 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, está casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Se dedica a la venta de ropa que trae de la ciudad de Lima. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a  viajar a Lima a traer la ropa que le solicitaron sus amistades, familiares y vecinos. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito de 1,200.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para viajar a Lima y cubrir los pedidos de ropa que tiene pendientes como: polos, camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos, etc. 
Actualmente se encuentra realizando sus ultimas cobranzas para reunir más dinero y ha planinificado viajar a Lima dentro de 2 semanas para realizar las compras de sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Kelly is 34 years old, and she lives in the Del Provenir District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Decididas ("Determined Women") Communal Bank. The member finished 11th grade. She is married and has two children who are economically dependent on her. She works selling clothing that she brings from the city of Lima. With her first loan of 300 soles she began to travel to Lima to bring back the clothes that her friends, relatives and neighbors asked her for. Now she will use her next loan of 1,200 soles to travel to Lima and fill the outstanding orders she has for clothes like: polo shirts, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc. She is currently collecting her final payments in order to raise more money, and she has planned to travel to Lima within 2 weeks to make the purchases for her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing: pants, shirts, blouses, jeans, etc.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, de 55 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijas; Mariela (21), Marianela (20) y Mónica (18). Juntas trabajan cada día para salir adelante.

Desde muy joven aprendió a hacer lindos decorados en material de corrospun (material micro poroso, tipo plástico de diferentes colores) para centros educativos y fiestas infantiles. Le gustaba dar vida a los personajes animados con cada trazo y cuando debió sacar adelante a sus tres hijas no dudó en trabajar en lo que mejor sabía hacer, pues debía conseguir que sus  hijas estudien y no les falte nada. A Delfina le entretiene mucho la producción de diferentes personajes animados en este material, ya que se requiere de paciencia y buen pulso y aunque es fácil, ella dice que lo difícil es perseverar en este negocio, pero lo ha logrado, ya que tiene varios pedidos de diferentes centros educativos en toda época del año. Su negocio le genera buenas ganancias económicas, por lo que para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa donde pueda ofrecer diferentes productos y también sus adornos en corrospun.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que su crédito para seguir trabajando. Por otro lado, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo, puesto que sus compañeras son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quieren quedar mal. Delfina tiene pensado destinar el dinero que solicita en la compra de material (corrospun), ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y quiere tener todo el material disponible.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her three daughters: Mariela (21), Marianela (20) y Mónica (18). They work together every day to succeed. From the time when she was very young she learned to make pretty decorations in corrospun material (micro-porous plastic-like material of different colors) for educational centers and children's parties. She liked bringing animated characters to life with every stroke and when she had to support her three daughters she did not hesitate to work in what she knew how to do best, because she needed to help her daughters study and to provide for them. Delfina enjoys the production of different animated characters in this material, since patience and a steady hand are required. Even though it is easy, she mentions how hard it is to persevere in this business, but she has made it because she has several orders from different educational centers throughout the year. Her business generates enough financial gain for her, and in the future she plans to install a small bazaar in her home where she can offer different products and also her corrospun decorations. This is the 4th loan she has with MFP and she is very grateful with everyone that makes her loan possible so that she can keep working. She is also very satisfied with the work of the group, since her partners are very punctual in their payments, because they don't want to leave a bad impression. Delfina wants to use the requested money to purchase material (corrospun), since she already has several orders to fulfill and she wants to have all the material available.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material for decorations

loans.name: Jesus Angelita

texts.es:
La señora JESUS ANGELITA tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES DECIDIDAS. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es separada y tiene 2 hijas quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas, cosméticos en su casa y ahora esta aprovechando el verano para vender raspadillas en una avenida cercana a su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles empezó a vender gaseosas, cervezas y también cosméticos como labiales, colonias, perfumes, talcos, etc.  
Con este crédito de 2,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de bancos (asientos), cerveza y gaseosas  al por mayor y también para surtir su stock de cosméticos comprará productos en ofertas como: colonias, labiales, rubores, deliniadores, shampoos, cremas, etc., para luego vender estos productos a mayor precio y aumentar así más sus ganancias.
Ella sueña con instalar en su casa una bodega para ampliar sus negocio y así poder obtener mayores ganancias para la crianza y educación de sus hijas.
texts.en:
JESUS ANGELITA is 35 years old and lives in the Del Provenir District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Decididas ("Determined Women") Communal Bank. She finished 11th grade, is separated and has 2 daughters who are economically dependent on her. She works selling beer, soft drinks, and cosmetics from her house and is now taking advantage of summertime to sell raspadillas (cold fruit drinks) on a street near her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, she began selling soft drinks, beer and also cosmetics like lipsticks, colognes, perfumes, powders, etc. She will use this loan of 2,000 soles to buy benches, beer and soft drinks wholesale, and also to increase her stock of cosmetics. She will buy products on sale (colognes, lipsticks, blush, eyeliners, shampoos, creams, etc.) to sell later at a higher price and in this way increase her profits. She dreams of setting up a store in her house to expand her business and earn more money for the care and education of her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase cases of soft drinks, wholesale beer, and cosmetics: colognes, lipsticks, blush, eyeliners, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos; José (10) y Carlos (14). Aunque está separada de su esposo, trabaja muy duro cada día para sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños.

Su esposo le dejó una pequeña combi (camioneta para 12 personas) para la brinde en alquiler y así pueda mantener a sus hijos, y así lo hizo. Todos los días a un chofer trabaja con esa camioneta haciendo transporte de pasajeros, siendo el hijo mayor de Gregoria quien hace las veces de cobrador en sus tiempos libres, a pesar de su corta edad también obtiene ganancias por su trabajo. Gregoria también es profesora en un centro educativo primario y se dedica a su profesión todos los días útiles de la semana, medio tiempo, para no descuidar a su hijo más pequeño y con las ganancias de la combi les alcanza para vivir cómodamente. Ella está muy orgullosa de sus hijos porque la ayudan bastante y porque son muy estudiosos y tienen beca en los centros donde estudian, lo que le permite ahorrar bastante dinero. Para el futuro quiere comprar otra combi para brindarla en alquiler y así obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito para seguir trabajando. Gregoria tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en el cambio de las llantas de su camioneta, ya que están deterioradas y con unas nuevas ofrecerá un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children: José (10) and Carlos (14). Even though she is separated from her husband, she works very hard every day to provide for her two little ones. Her husband left her a small VW van (van for 12 people) so she can rent it and in this way support her children. Every day a chauffeur works with this van to transport passengers. Her eldest son helps out as a payment collector in his free time; despite his young age he obtains some profit from his work. Gregoria is also a teacher in an elementary school and is devoted to her profession part-time every weekday, so that she has enough time for her youngest son. With the earnings from the van they have enough to get by comfortably. She is very proud of her children because they help her out a lot and because they are good students and have a scholarship in their schools, which allows her to save a lot of money. In the future she wants to buy another van to rent it and in this way earn more money. This is the 1st loan she has with MFP and she is very grateful with everyone that makes the loan that keeps her working possible. Gregoria is planning to invest the money in new tires for her van, because the old ones are deteriorated. With the new ones she will be able to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change of tires for her van

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 55 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos; William (22) y Ronald (20), en una populosa zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde que era muy joven aprendió el arte del tejido a mano con lana e hilo de diferentes colores. Para sacar adelante a sus hijos siempre trabajó tejiendo, en la actualidad son ellos quienes trabajan y cubren los gastos del hogar, pero Margarita sigue tejiendo porque es un  pasatiempo y porque no puede dejarlo, pues ama esta actividad. Como ya tiene clientes regulares, constantemente le hace pedidos de colchas, mantas, chompas, etc., las cuales  teje con mucha creatividad y le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pues compra la lana al por mayor y teje bastante rápido. Esta trabajadora mujer, los fines de semana no descansa, por lo contrario se dedica a vender ceviche (platillo típico a base de pescado) y picarones (postre), en una mesita que acondiciona fuera de su casa y le va muy bien porque se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Para el futuro quiere tener un pequeño puesto de venta de comida más estable en el mercado de su localidad.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le ayudará a seguir progresando. Margarita tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de varias madejas de lana al por mayor, ya que tiene varios pedidos de colchas por elaborar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children: William (22) and Ronald (20), in a populated area in the mountains of Peru. From the time when she was very young she learned the art of hand knitting with wool and weaving different colored thread. To support her children she has always worked by knitting, and currently they are the ones that work and cover the expenses of the home. However, Margarita keeps knitting because it is her pastime and she can't stop doing the activity she loves so much. Since she already has regular customers, she constantly gets orders for covers, blankets, sweaters, etc. which she knits with a lot of creativity and that generate financial gain since she purchases wool in bulk and knits very quickly. This working woman does not rest during the weekend; on the contrary, she is devoted to selling ceviche (typical dish made of fish) and picarones (a dessert) in a small table that she sets outside her home. She does well because she puts in a lot of effort to succeed. In the future she wants a small stand to become a stable supplier of food in a market nearby. This is the 1st loan she has with MFP and she is very grateful with everyone that makes it possible for her to have access to the loan that will allow her to keep making progress. Margarita wants to invest the money to purchase wool in bulk, since she has several orders to make blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in bulk

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 25 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Roger (30), que es maestro de construcción, y de su pequeño hijo Jean Pierre (2).

Desde hace 4 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, la modalidad de su trabajo es la siguiente: compra ropa en la ciudad a precios cómodos y la trae al lugar donde vive, vende a sus vecinos y amigos a un poco más del precio original y brinda la mercadería al crédito, es decir le van pagando por partes y cuando terminan de cancelar ella les entrega la prenda deseada. Para Nancy este es un negocio muy rentable, ya que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico y lo puede hacer en la tranquilidad de su hogar, de esta manera apoya a su esposo en algunos gastos domésticos. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes, entre ellos; tener un puesto de venta de ropa en algún centro comercial y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará.

Este es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hace posible que acceder al crédito y pueda seguir trabajando para progresar. A su vez, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo, ya que está integrado por mujeres muy responsables, como ella. 
Nancy tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que por temporada tiene varios pedidos y quiere comprar todo en un solo viaje a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Nancy is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Roger (30), who is a master of construction, and with her son Jean Pierre (2). For the past four years she’s been selling clothing. Her method is as follows: she buys clothing at comfortable prices in the city, brings it to the area where she lives, and sells to her friends and neighbors for a small profit. She sells on lay-away and her customers pay a little at a time. When they’ve finished paying for the items, she releases the clothing. For Nancy, this is a profitable business. It doesn’t require much investment and she can do it from the comfort of her home. This way she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. She has many plans for the future, among them is opening a clothing store in a shopping center. She knows that, with great effort, she will succeed. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all those people who make it possible for her to get this loan so that she can continue to work to get ahead. She is very happy with her group’s accomplishments, as it is made up of responsible women, like her. Nancy plans to use the money from this loan to buy large quantities of clothing. Now that she has had many requests, she wants to buy everything at once and only make one trip to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 54 años, vive en la casa de su hija mayor, con ella, su esposo y sus nietos.
Esta trabajadora mujer sigue luchando cada día por salir adelante y aunque ya no tiene a quién mantener, sus ganas de vivir y ayudar a sus nietos hacen que a diario se levante muy temprano para ayudar a su hija en su restaurante. Susana cocina diversos platillos durante la mañana, sabe que tiene buena sazón y le gusta mucho este oficio, ya que su hija le paga un sueldo y así puede generarse un dinero que le ayuda a suplir sus necesidades sin molestar a nadie. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene planeado para el futuro instalar su propio restaurante, además quisiera llevar algunos cursos de cocina para seguir aprendiendo.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le ayudará a seguir progresando. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para su cocina y otra parte la utilizará en comprar algunos cucharones, pues los que tiene están deteriorados.
texts.en:
Susna is 54 years old and she, her husband, and grandchildren live in her oldest daughter's home. This hard working woman battles each day to get ahead, and even though she doesn't need to, her desire to help her grandchildren motivate her to rise early each morning to help her daughter in her restaurant. Susana cooks various dishes in the morning. She knows that she has a knack for it and she likes doing this, especially since her daughter pays her a salary. This way she is able to earn some money, which helps to supplement her needs without bothering anybody. Because she is an enterprising woman, she plans to open her own restaurant. She would also like to take a few cooking classes in order to continue learning. This will be her fourth loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make it possible for her to receive this loan and help her to move ahead. She will use the money to invest in ingredients for her kitchen. She will also use part of the money to buy some kitchen utensils because the ones she has are deteriorating.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and utensils

loans.name: El Exito Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de personas que viven a las orillas del pueblo de Momostenango, Las personas integrantes del grupo se dedican mayormente  al comercio a la venta  de ropa, venta de cosmeticos y las otras integrantes se dedican a la venta de comida otras personas se dedican a la elaboracion de hilos para pañuelos, y se determino que tienen capacidad para solventar dicho compromiso con la Asociación,  ya  que el préstamo les permitirá mejorar el negocio que cada uno tiene, con el financiamiento en ASDIR ayudará a incrementar el capital que manejan, esto permite que pueden crecer de una buena manera con el negocio con la que cuentan, en el lugar donde residen estas personas no cuentan con accesos para los prestamos por tal razón han acudido a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un prestamo con el fin de poder ayudar a mejorar la economia de cada una de sus familias, y tener mejores conodiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This is a group of people who live on the outskirts of the village of Momostenango. Most of the members of the group sell clothing and cosmetics. Others sell food, and still others manufacture threads for handkerchiefs. The association has determined that they have the means to enter into this commitment, since this loan will help them better their businesses. The financing through ASDIR will help them increase their working capital and allow them to grow. They don't have access to any other loans and for this reason they have approached ASDIR to help them grow their business, which will give their families better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes Del Carmen tiene la edad de 44 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que obtiene con los financiamientos, ella distribuye sus productos por encargos pues es así que obtiene más clientes. Ya que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital suficiente. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 year old and has been selling general merchandise for three years. This is not her first experience with credit, as she distributes her products to order because this allows her to have more customers. Starting was challenging for her because she did not have enough capital. She is asking for this loan in order to buy shoes, perfumes, and general clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Erica Yony

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Erica, pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años de edad, ella es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia vende en la estación del tren en Ollantaytambo  desde hace 4 años atrás junto a su madre, chifles(plátanos, camotes, papas, habas, fritas), desayunos (quinua con leche y sandwich), emolientes (bebidas calientes, hierbas medicinales hervidas, tipo mates), Nuestra socia aprendió el negocio de sus madre lo cual le permite ahora a ella, continuar con este negocio y sacar adelante a su hijo, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de azúcar, quinua, leche, aceite.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Erica, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is a 30 year old single mother with a seven year-old son and alternates her activities between her household chores and those of a small business, selling various types of fried chips (bananas, sweet potatoes, potatoes, beans), breakfast (quinua with milk, and sandwiches), hot drinks and boiled medicinal herbs such as “mate,” at the train station in “Ollantaytambo.” She has been doing this with her mother for four years. She learned the business from her mother and it now provides her with an income that allows her to help her son get ahead. She is asking for this loan in order to buy sugar, quinua, milk, and cooking oil. Our associate is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to repay her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Teofila , pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña ”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 57 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales la socia vive 3 D. 30,23,20 años D. edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia es madre D. Erica y ella trabaja desD. que era niña, se casó y tuvo a sus hijos, a los que siempre les enseñó que la vida significaba esfuerzo y las cosas materiales se obtenían a base sólo D. trabajo digno, nuestra socia cuenta que ella fue una D. las primeras vendedoras D. golosinas y moraya con queso (papa deshidratada con queso fresco), en la estación D. trenes a Machupicchu, ahora la socia tiene su credencial para poder subir al tren D. turistas y otros vagones permitidos para venderles chifles (plátanos fritos, papas fritas, camotes, habas, entre otros);  Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para terminar D. pagar al banco sobre un préstamo que pidió para pagar la postulación D. su hija que ingresó a la policía y dio una garantía, también cubrirá su penúltima cuota D. pago sobre  la congeladora que sacó D. una tienda D. electrodomésticos.     

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Teofila, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 57 years old, married, and has five children, of whom three, ages 30, 23, and 20, live with her. She alternates her activities between her household chores and a small business. She is Erica’s mother and she has been working since she was a little girl. She married and had children, whom she taught that life required effort and that material things were obtained by working with dignity. She was one of the top sellers of sweet treats and “moraya con queso” (dried potatoes with cheese) at the rail station in Machupiccu. Now she has her permit that allows her to board and sell her wares on tourist trains and other rail cars. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to repay a previous loan to a commercial bank, which she requested to post a bond for her daughter who entered the police force. She will also pay off the freezer that she bought from an electronics store. Our associate appreciates the opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repay a loan from a commercial bank

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío El Pueblito, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde muy joven se ha ganado la vida dedicándose a la agricultura junto a su esposo. Ellos usualmente siembran maracuyá (planta frutal de la zona) y limón. Los frutos recolectados son vendidos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona y eventualmente en el mercado de la ciudad de Olmos.

Actualmente han instalado cultivo de maracuyá en un terreno de una hectárea de extensión, el cultivo ya tiene 5 meses y es necesario brindarle mantenimiento para que la producción sea favorable. Natividad no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Natividad es una mujer estimada y respetada por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 53 year old mother who lives with her husband in the El Pueblito village in the Olmos district, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has made a living farming alongside her husband, since she was very young. They usually plant “maracuyá” (a fruiting plant from the region) and limes. They harvest and sell the fruit to businesses who frequent the zone and in the marketplace in the city of Olmos. They have started raising maracuyá on a hectare extension of land. The crop is five months old and needs to be maintained so that it will yield a good harvest. Natividad does not have the necessary capital, so she is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) that she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides. Natividad is a very well liked and respected woman in her zone. They consider her to be a very responsible, hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Lucia , pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña ”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 7 hijos en la actualidad la socia vive con uno D. ellos D. 20 años es el menor D. sus hijos. Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia venD. queso en la provincia D. Urubamba los días miércoles y los domingos en chicheros, la socia lleva los quesos a vender desD. hace 20 años, la socia elabora los quesos en su propio domicilio y tiene varios tipos D. queso, los que tienen más sal, otros con poca sal, otros más cremosos, otros más firmes, para mesa, para cocina y así mucho más variedad,  ella solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaquita para que le D. leche y con esa misma leche poder hacer sus quesos, porque hasta ahora ella tenía que comprar la leche para elaborar sus quesos.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Lucia, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. Her youngest son, age 20, lives with her. She alternates her activities between her household chores and those of a small business, selling cheese, every Wednesday and Sunday in the province of Urubamba. She has been selling cheese for the past 20 years and makes various types of cheeses (salty, less salty, creamy, hard, for the table, for cooking, and many others) in her own home. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a dairy cow so that she can use the milk to make her cheeses. At this time she has to buy the milk. She is thankful for this opportunity and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Isabel , pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
Nuestra socia tiene 43 ella es conviviente y tiene  5 hijos 23, 21, 16, 12, 10 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, también la socia cría chanchos, la inundación que sufrió la ciudad del Cusco afecto a muchísimas provincias entre ellas la provincia de Anta – Vallecito, nuestra socia perdió sus chanchos y muchas cositas que salieron flotando de su casa; su casita aunque no se cayó del todo, está a punto de caer, la socia está desesperada y tiene a su hermana socia del mismo grupo que perdió toda su casa nueva y junto a esta perdió los ahorros de toda su vida, ella solo pudo sacar a sus hijos de la casa y a los minutos siguientes se desplomo la casa, matando a sus animales y llevándose todo a su paso entre ellos el dinero que tenía guardado, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo  para comprar  materiales de construcción y tratar de levantar su casita una vez que la demuelan, también ayudará a su hermana.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Isabel, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 43 years old, married and has five children, ages 23, 21, 16, 12 and 10. She alternates her activities between her household activities and those of her small business, buying and selling livestock. She also raises hogs. The floods that Cusco suffered affected the local provinces very much including Anta-Vallecito. Our associate, lost her hogs and many things that floated away from her home. Although her home was not completely destroyed, it is about to fall and she is desperate. Her sister from the same group also completely lost her new home and life’s savings. She [Isabel] was able to save her children but a few minutes later the house collapsed, killing her animals and taking everything else in its wake, including the money she had saved. She is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials to try to rebuild her home once it’s demolished, and also to help her sister. She appreciates this opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Juan, pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 58 años es conviviente de la socia Isabel  5 hijos  de 23, 21, 16, 12, 10 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos, él junto a su familia lo perdió casi todo, el río arrasó con las casas, chacras, animales y todo a su pasó a esto le continuó un alud que cubrió los distritos continuos,  nuestro socio desea ahora el préstamo para volver a construir su casa e implementar con las necesidades básicas, están en espera de que sus casa sean demolidas para empezar de nuevo.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Juan, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. He is 58 years old and married to our associate Isabel. They have five children, ages 23, 21, 16, 12, and 10. He buys and sells cattle. He and his family have lost nearly everything. The [rising] river obliterated homes, ranches, animals, and everything in its path. This was followed by an avalanche that covered the entire district. Our associate is asking for a loan in order to rebuild his home and meet some basic needs. They are waiting for their home to be demolished in order to start anew. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Segundina, pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña  ”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es viuda, ella tiene 1 hijo de 27 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna las actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia es padre y madre para su hijo actualmente está estudiando en la universidad y ella lo está apoyando económicamente, en Cusco su hijo alquiló un cuarto para él y ella le envía el dinero para sus gastos de alimentación y hospedaje, también cuanta la socia que su hijo necesita comprar libros y hacer trabajos en diferentes cursos por lo que genera un costo que ella debe cubrir mensualmente, la socia lleva fruta a vender al departamento de Abancay, nuestra socia compra del valle al por mayor fruta y lo lleva a la Abancay y vende fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor número de fruta y así incrementar sus ventas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our partner Segundina belongs to the communal bank “Amanecer Anteña ”. She is located in the district of Anta Iscuchaka, 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco. Segundina is 56 years old, and a widow. She has one son who is 27 years old. She alternates between the activities of the home and a retail business. Our partner is father and mother to her son who is in college and she supports him financially. In Cuzco, her son rented a room for himself and she send him money for room and board. She also relates that her son needs to buy books and do assignments in different classes which incur expenses that she has to pay every month. Segundina takes fruit to sell in the department of Abancay. She buys the fruit wholesale in the valley and takes it to Abancay to sell. She is asking for the loan to purchase a greater quantity of fruit and thus increase her sales. Our partner is grateful for the opportunity offered and she is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner is asking for the loan to purchase a greater quantity of fruit and thus increase her sales.

loans.name: Victor Raúl

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Victor Raúl,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 53 años de edad, nuestro socio es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 25, 23 años de edad, Nuestro socio es profesor jubilado, nuestro socio está educando a su menor hijo en la universidad y al segundo está terminando de pagarle los últimos semestres de sus estudios, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder hacer el pago de mensualidades de su hijo.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Victor Raúl belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank. He lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district 45 minutes from Cusco. He is 53, married, with 3 children ages 27, 25 and 23. He is a retired professor, currently educating his youngest son at the university as well as completing payments for the education of his second son. He is requesting a loan in order to make the monthly payments for his son. He appreciates this opportunity and commits himself to complete his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University tuition for his son

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Leonor,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito D. Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años D. edad, nuestra socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. 27, 25, 23 años D. edad, Nuestra socia  es docente D. inicial, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia, ella disfruta mucho D. su trabajo pero está entrando al retiro, ella ahora desea comprar leche fresca y lo venderá, se va a dedicar a este negocio D. compra y venta D. leche.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Leonor belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank. She lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, 45 minutes from Cusco. She is 54, married, with 3 children ages 27, 25, and 23. She is an early education teacher, balancing her household activities with teaching. She very much enjoys her work, but she is beginning retirement. She wants to buy fresh milk to sell, she plans to have a business buying and selling milk. She appreciates this opportunity and commits herself to make every payment according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Las Estrellas Numero Uno Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de 5 personas que viven en un lugar llamado Rachoquel, del municipio de Momostenango, actualmente cuentan con negocio, venta de ropa nueva, llevan 3 años de empezar dicho negocio, actualemente la crisis economica les ha afectado bastante debido a que ya no venden sus productos como antes, por eso necesitan incrementar el capital de trabajo con la que cuentan, y solamente de esa manera podrán continuar el proceso de venta sobre sus comercio, y no tener que llegar a una extrema pobreza, con el financiamiento que obtedrán pueden combatir de cierta manera la crisis economica, y seguir ayudando a su familia que tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
This is a group of five persons who live in a place called Rachoquel, in the city of Momostenango. They sell new clothing and started this business three years ago. The economic crisis has affected them very much, and they are not able to sell as much as they used to. They need to increase their working capital and this is the only way they will be able to continue making progress in their business and not slip into poverty. With this financing, they will be able to see through the economic crisis and continue to help their families, who are in desperate need.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Bernardina,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  48 años de edad, nuestra socia es soltera tiene una tienda abarrotes,  la socia ayuda a cuidar a su mamá y se dedica de lleno a su tienda de abarrotes, nuestra socia es una mujer muy buena y dedicada a su familia, ella no tiene hijos y nunca se caso debido a una mala experiencia, pero a cambio cuida y adora a sus padres y en todo lo que ella puede ayuda a sus hermanos y sobrinos, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su pequeña tienda abarrotes y comprar mercadería. 

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Bernardina, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. Our associate is 48 years old, single. She helps care for her mother and runs a small grocery store. She is a very good woman who is dedicated to her family. She has no children of her own and never married due to a bad experience, but now she cares for and loves her parents and helps her brothers and nephews all that she can. She is asking for a loan in order to be able to start a small grocery store and invest in inventory. She is thankful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Clara,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  57 años de edad, nuestra socia es viuda y 4 hijos de 38, 35, 30, 28 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia  tiene una tienda abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes ella comprará mercadería y obtendrá mejores ganancias para continuar ayudando en los estudios a sus hijos en la universidad, nuestra socia tiene este negocio 10 años y con esto los ha educado a sus hijos y continua haciéndolo. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Clara, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. She is 57 years old and a widowed with four children, ages 38, 35, 30, and 28. She alternates her activity between her household work and that of her small business, a small grocery shop. She would like to buy merchandise in order to stock her shop and improve her income in order to be able to continue helping her college aged sons pay for their education. She has had this business for 10 years and has paid for her children’s education and continues to do so. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise and stock her store. She appreciates this opportunity and promises to repay her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Luzgarda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Luzgarda,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, nuestra socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 11, 1año y seis meses de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tenía un pozo especial para macerar la jora, que es residuo del maíz y este se hierve para fermentarlo y crear la chicha de jora, conocida en el tiempo de los inkas como la bebida sagrada esta es una bebida a base de maíz, Nuestra socia vendía está chicha en su casa, pero la socia fue afectada por las lluvias y perdió toda su casa y sus cosas, con ellos ahora se ve perjudicada en todo aspecto, actualmente están ubicados en el colegio del pueblo recibiendo alimentos y durmiendo en carpas con toda su familia, pero la socia está ya enferma y quiere alquilar un espacio en otro lugar para volver a poner su negocio y seguir manteniendo su hogar, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para capital de trabajo y volver a construir su vivienda y dar mejor calidad a sus hijos que están enfermándose.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Luzgarda, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. Our associate is 31 years old, married, and has three children, ages 13, 11, and 1 ½ . She alternates her activities between her household chores and that of her small business. She used to have a small pool used to macerate “jora,” a corn residue which is boiled and fermented to make “chicha.” In the time of the Incas, this was known as the sacred beverage. She used to sell this chicha from her home, but she was affected by the recent rains and she lost her home and all of her possessions. Now she is disadvantaged in every way and the whole family is currently sheltered in tents at a local school, where they also receive food. She is also sick and wants to rent space somewhere else where she can restart her business and continue to maintain her home. She needs this loan to provide working capital and to rebuild her house to give her children, who are also getting sick, a better quality of life. She appreciates this opportunity and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to restart her business and rebuild her home

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo Antonio M. con dos crédito que ha tenido con FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le esta haciendo falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa  de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
Es esta solicitando el préstamo para construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como secretario general del sindicato del empleo. 
Su deseo es que sus casa y familia este mas seguros y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Ricardo has used the previous two loans through FVP to build a new room but it still needs a roof. He plans to build a concrete slab so that the home will be more secure and last longer. He is asking for this loan to pay for the construction and plans to repay it from the income he receives from his job as an office assistant at the employment office. He would like his home and family to feel more secure and live better.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab roof

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu A. (0) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Banyubiru. Ni Putu is the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ratna S. (MUK-0005).

Ni Putu is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK.

Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


*****************************************************
Ni Putu A. (0) merupakan 34 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Banyubiru. Ni Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah RATNA S. (MUK-0005).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2008, Ni Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. 0 Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,400,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca las mariitas el señor Reynaldo M. Vílchez, se dedica a la producción de productos agropecuarios como son el ganado bobino, porcino, y aviar también establece cultivos de subsistencia como yuca, camote, maíz, ajonjolí entre otros, los que le facilitan la mantención de sus hijos y esposa.
El señor Reynaldo M. ha dedicado toda su vida a realizar las actividades agropecuarias realizando jornadas de 7 a 6 de la tarde todos los días de la semana, solicita un crédito para ayudarse un poco con la mano de obra que necesita para realizar la chapea de sus potreros.
texts.en:
Reynaldo raises livestock, including cattle, hogs, and poultry, in the municipality of Somotillo, located in the Mariitas region. He also raises yucca, sweet potatoes, corn, and sesame, among other things. All this helps support his wife and children. Reynaldo has been doing agriculture all his life, making day trips from 7 to 6 in the evening every day of the week. He is asking for this loan in order to help pay for labor that he needs to make the veneer for his gates.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Toos and labor

loans.name: Cruz Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca rodeo grande el señor Cruz Antonio B. G., se dedica a la producción agropecuaria dentro de lo cual el desarrolla la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y avícola también establece cultivos de oleaginosas como ajonjolí.
El señor Cruz B. realiza sus actividades en una jornada de 6 a 12 del día todos los días de la semana, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El crédito será empleado para la compra de tres vacas paridas las que contribuirán a aumentar su hato ganadero y mejorar sus ingresos productivo
texts.en:
In Somotillo, Rodeo Grande region, Señor Cruz Antonio B. G. engages in farming , raising cattle, pork, and poultry; he is also establishing oilseed crops such as sesame. Señor Cruz B. works from 6 to 12 every day of the week, with his wife and three children. This loan will be used to purchase three recently calved cows to increase his herd and improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Ana Gloriela

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es el esposo de la señora Gloriela.
Ana Gloriela y su esposo desde hace 5 años invirtieron sus ahorros en un negocio pero en el que su esposo desempeñara sus conocimientos de veterinario. Es por ello que pensaron en poner una forrajearía llamada “Sinai” donde vende alimentos, medicinas y accesorios para animales. El señor Alain esposo de Ana Gloriela consulta en  ese mismo lugar a los animalitos cuando tienen alguna emergencia, enfermedad o ya sea vacunas para mejorar su salud. En este momento necesitan invertir en este negocio para tener más ingresos y tener las cosas necesaria para poder dar mejor atención a los clientes que recurran con sus animalitos.
texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Gloriela’s husband. Ana Gloriela and her husband of five years invested their savings in a business that allowed her husband to practice his skills as a veterinarian. This is why they decided to open an animal feed store called “Sinai,” where they sell feed, medicines, and accessories for animals. Alain, Ana’s husband, also treats small animals there, whenever they are hurt, sick, or in need of vaccines to keep them healthy. At this time they need to make another investment into their business, in order to increase their income and have the things they need to be able to better serve their customers who bring in their small animals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Edit

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca  rodeo grande la señora Edit A. A. vende abarrotería en general, el crédito solicitado será empleado para comprar mas mercadería y aumentar su inventario, mejorando de esta forma las ventas.
Su negocio empezó cuando doña Edit empezó a vender granos básicos y algunas bebidas, luego de algunos años este crecieron y actualmente es una de las tiendas más populares de la comunidad.
Ella tiene 10 años de tener este negocio en su casa de habitación en donde trabaja de 6 am a 8 pm de la noche espera mejorar su condición económica como lo ha hecho con los créditos que Ceprodel le ha financiado, puesto que ha aumentado su cantidad de productos y ofrece de esta manera una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edit sells general groceries in the municipality of Somotillo, in the Rodeo Grande region. She will use the money from this loan to buy additional merchandise to increase her inventory and sales. Her business started when she began selling basic grains and a few drinks. Within a few years, the business grew and it’s now one of the more popular stores in the community. She has had this business in her home for ten years, where she works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm. She hopes to increase her income with the help of this loan through CEPRODEL. She will increase her inventory and be able to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael Pérez M. es un hombre que desea ir mejorando su calidad de vida es por ello que para obtener mas ingresos puso en un negocio de abarrotes y mercería en que ofrece calidad y buen precio. Rafael aparte de su negocio por la tardes trabaja en un centro comercial en el área de cocina para así poder estas pagando su casa de interés social. Este crédito será el segundo que el tramitaría en el que pago muy bien y comenta estar agradecido por el apoyo brindado por que ha podido realizar su proyecto. En este momento Rafael quiere poner vitro piso en el cuarto de enfrente donde esta el negocio para dar mejor presentación a sus clientes y para esto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Rafael would like to improve his quality of life. In order to increase his income, he opened a shop to sell groceries and other quality items at a good prices. Besides his evening business, he also works in the kitchen section at a shopping center. This way he is able to pay for his home. This will be his second loan and he did a good job paying on his previous one. He tells us that he appreciates the support he has gotten and that it enabled him to complete his project. Rafael would like to install a tile floor in his front room where his business is located in order to make a better impression on his customers. He needs to buy building materials and pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor

loans.name: Ricardo Arnulfo

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es la esposa del Ricardo Arnulfo.
Ricardo Arnulfo recibió un terreno que le heredo su abuelo materno, ahora ya construyo su casa con ahorros propios, pero ahora se ve en la necesidad de construir un cuarto de baño para no exponer a sus 3 hijos a que puedan contagiarse de un enfermedad infecciosa. El baño que quiere poner lo quiere dejar bien acondicionado con drenaje y taza de baño para no seguir afectando con la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Ricardo’s wife. Ricardo inherited some land from his maternal grandfather. He built a house on it, but now he needs to build a bathroom so as not to expose his three children to infectious diseases. He wants to build a well equipped bathroom with a toilet and good drainage, so as not to continue to adversely affect his family’s health.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: Fausto D. A. es un hombre preocupado por el bienestar D. su familia, el va por su cuarto crédito en esta institución en el que esta agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha dado por que es D. la única manera que ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Fausto y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora para el sustento D. sus gastos familiares. Ellos tiene 2 hijos a los cuales quieren ofrecerles comodidad y un patrimonio. La casa que ellos tienen fue construida con dinero que aquí mismo se les otorgo y ahora quieren poner vitropiso en uno D. los cuarto acondicionarlo  para poderlo habitar y así tener mas espacio.
texts.en:
Fausto is worried about his family’s well-being. He is requesting his fourth loan through this institution for whose support he is very thankful because this is the only way he has been able to realize his projects. Fausto and his wife work in a machine shop in order to support their family. They have two children to whom they want to offer comfort and parenting. Their home was built with money from a grant and now they want to install a tile floor in one of the completed rooms so that they can have more living space.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install tile floor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy zinc, nails, timber, etc.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Maria Guadalupe C. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a terminar la construcción.
Nuevamente está solicitando otro préstamo para terminar los acabados del interior del cuarto que realizo.
Planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como subgerente.
texts.en:
Maria is very thankful for the previous loan which helped her complete her construction. She is now asking for another loan in order to finish the interior of the room she built. She plans to repay the loan with the income she receives from her job as an assistant manager.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete room interior

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca la flor, el señor Mauro Q. se dedica a la producción agropecuaria en la que realiza varios cultivos como son la crianza de ganado como es bobino, porcino y avícola en sistema intensivo y el establecimiento de cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo los que proveen el medio para el sostén de sus cinco hijas y su esposa, el señor Mauro Q. trabaja de 6 a 2 de la tarde en las tareas agropecuarias junto con su familia.
El crédito que el solicita será empleado en la compra de una vaca parida la cual ayudara a aumentar su hato ganadero y mejorara los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, in the Flor district, Señor Mauro Q. raises animals and crops. He produces various products, raising animals such as cattle, young pigs, and poultry in an intensive system and establishing crops such as corn, sesame, and sorghum, which provide the means of support for his five daughters and his wife. Señor Mauro Q. works with his family from 6 until 2 in the afternoon doing the farm chores. The loan which he is requesting will be used in the purchase of a cow that has just given birth, which will help increase his herd and improve the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow that has just given birth

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
Den T., age 49, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately $4 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2004. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. The standard of living has been improved since T. began this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more silk. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to weave for sale

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca rodeo grande sector los esterios, el señor Bismarck Antonio M. Rodríguez, se dedica a la producción de ganado bobino, porcino y avícola, también es empleado del fondo de desarrollo local sucursal Somotillo en donde tiene 12 años de laborar empresa cuya actividad es otorgar créditos, el señor Bismarck M. ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a estas actividades agropecuarias ya que le facilitan los ingresos necesarios para la mantención de su hogar y familia que esta constituida de su esposa e hijo.
El crédito será empleado en la compra de alambre y poste los que usara para mejorar su infraestructura de la finca.
texts.en:
Bismark Antonio raises cattle, hogs, and poultry in the municipality of Somotillo, in the Rodeo Grande region. He is also employed by the local branch of the “Fondo de Desarrollo” (Development Fund), which helps obtain loans for entrepreneurs. Bismark has spent most of his life doing agriculture, since it provides the necessary income to support his home and family, consisting of his wife and son. He will use the money from this loan to buy wire and posts which he will use to build a fence.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fence building supplies

loans.name: Nilda I

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 58 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a una hija en el distrito D. Pueblo Nuevo D. la ciudad D. Ferreñafe, ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado desD. su juventud a la agricultura en un terreno ubicado en el distrito D. Manuel Mesones Muro, a media hora del lugar en donD. vive, usualmente siembra arroz y maíz y depenD. D. estas actividades para sustentarse.

Nilda ha instalado una hectárea D. arroz en su terreno, actualmente el cultivo ya está transplatado y necesita D. mantenimiento para poder asegurarse una buena producción. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Nilda es una persona bastante trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. las dificultades. Ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nilda is 58 years old and a widow. She lives with one of her daughters in the Pueblo Nuevo district in the city of Ferreñafe, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was young, she has been farming on land located in the Manuel Mesones Muro district, 30 minutes from her home. She usually raises rice and corn and she supports herself from these activities. Nilda has planted a hectare of rice on her land. Now the crop has been transplanted and she needs to maintain it in order to ensure a good harvest. She is requesting a 2,000 PEN ($700) loan through Edpyme Alternativa that she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Nilda is a very hard working person who has learned how to get ahead, despite difficulty. She has worked with our institution in the past and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in repaying her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Siam

texts.en:
Siam V., age 39, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2004. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. The standard of living has been improved since V. started this business, so she would like to have a loan to expand her business.

V. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more raw silk. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk for weaving

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Mrs. Estrella D. is from the village of Bigaan, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with five children who are now adults. She owns and operates a business selling gasoline and variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years. She earns 5,000 monthly from the business. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La señora Maricela B. es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, ella es propietaria de unos locales, los cuales tiene rentados a diferentes negocio de gran importancia dentro de nuestra ciudad. Ella esta tramitando este crédito para la colocación de poliuretano a su hogar para mayor confortabilidad.
texts.en:
Señora Maricela B. is a very responsible and hard-working person. She is proprietress of several business locations that are rented to various businesses important to our city. She is undertaking this loan to lay polyurethane in her home for greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of polyurethane

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em M., age 34, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is employed at a local garment factory in the province, earning approximately $2.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2004. Her husband operates his motorbike as taxi driver, earning an income of $4 per day. The standard of living has been improved since M. has been with this business, so she would like to have a loan to expand her husband's business. 

M. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva. (M. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo B. es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución, al igual que su familia ya que son unas personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, pero sobretodo comprometido con su objetivo. Ellos están tramitando este nuevo crédito para la colocación de una losa en el cuarto que tienen en construcción, lo cual es para una mayor amplitud y comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Eduardo B. is a distinguished client of our institution. His family members are all very responsible and hard-working, and above all committed to his goals. They are undertaking this loan to install a flagstone floor in the room currently under construction, for additional space and comfort for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of flooring

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia T. is from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 52 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a general store, selling items in the local community. Antonia has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Antonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for house repairs. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Antonia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
En la comarca rodeo grande sector el quebrachal, el señor Roberto Carlos B. realiza múltiples actividades agropecuarias dentro de las cuales destacan la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, así como también el establecimiento de cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo, dichas actividades las realiza en una jornada de 6 a 3 de la tarde en conjunto  con su familia la cual esta constituida de su esposa y dos hijos, dichas actividades proveen los recursos financieros y alimentarios para su hogar.
Con el crédito solicitado comprara una vaca parida mejorando y aumentando su hato ganadero y sus ingresos, también de esta forma asegura un alimento muy importante en su dieta alimentaria y la su familia
texts.en:
In the region rodeo grande, el quebrachal sector, Mr. Roberto Carlos B. has multiple agriculture and cattle activities. He excels in raising cattle, pigs and birds, as well as in growing corn, sesame, and sorghum crops. The previously described activities, he does from 6 to 3 in the afternoon with the help of his family, his wife and two children. The work that they do gives them the financial and nourishment needed to support their home.

With the loan granted, he will buy a calving cow to improve and increase his herd of cattle and his income, as well as, securing a very important food product in his diet and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calving cow.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca el caimito, el señor Reynaldo Martínez, se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su viada al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias dentro de las cuales se destacan la crianza de ganado tanto mayor y menor especies como  ganado bobino, porcino y aviar también establece cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo dichas actividades las realiza con su esposa y nieto que tiene a cargo en una jornada de 6 a 2 de la tarde, con el crédito solicitado será empleado en la compra de tres vacas paridas las que garantizaran parte de su alimentos para su hogar, así como también la mejora y aumento de su hato ganadero y de esta manera mejorar su condición social.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, in the region of Caimito, Mr. Reynaldo M.has worked for most of his life in agriculture and cattle activities. He stands out in rearing cattle and low species like cattle, pigs, and birds. He also has various crops like: corn, sesame, and sorghum. The activities described, he does with his wife and grandson, his working day is from 6 to 2 in the afternoon. With the loan he will buy 3 calving cows that will guarantee part of the food for his home, as well as increase his herd of cattle, which will improve his social standing.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 calving cows.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn C., age 25, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has a young child. She is employed at a local garment factory in the province, earning approximately $2.50 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially for the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2005. Her husband operates a business of transporting goods to sell everywhere in the province, earning an income of $6 per day. The standard of living has been improved since C. has been with this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her husband's business. 

C. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more goods for her husband to expand his business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more goods to expand the business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Christine owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Christine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Christine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Mrs. Gina M. is 44 years old and is married with two children. She presently lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Gina has owned a sari-sari (variety) store for more than two years and her husband is a construction worker who is also supporting their needs. Their combined income is approximately 8,800 PHP a month. Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is to have additional capital for her sari-sari store. It is her 2nd loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Melinda owns and operates a business selling seafood products like a variety of fish in the local community.
